Title: Prácticas Análisis de Datos BI - Académico
Description:
Desde EAE Barcelona, parte de Grupo Planeta, estamos buscando incorporar un/a estudiante para realizar prácticas de Análisis de Datos BI Académico e incorporarse en el departamento académico.

¿Cuál será tu principal misión?

Contribuir al análisis y visualización de datos para apoyar la toma de decisiones estratégicas en el departamento académico, mejorando la eficiencia operativa y la calidad de los procesos académicos.

¿En qué consistirá tu día a día?


Recolección y limpieza de Datos: Asistir en la recopilación y preparación de datos relevantes de diversas fuentes internas y externas (Atenea, Blackboard, Survey Monkey, etc), asegurando su precisión y calidad.
Apoyo al análisis de datos: Realizar análisis de datos para identificar tendencias, patrones y oportunidades de mejora en procesos académicos.
Apoyo al desarrollo de Informes y Dashboards: alimentar los informes y dashboards interactivos para visualizar datos y métricas clave, facilitando la interpretación de los resultados por parte del equipo académico y administrativo.
Apoyo a la automatización de procesos: Colaborar en la automatización de la recolección y análisis de datos para optimizar la eficiencia y reducir la carga manual de tareas repetitivas.



Requisitos:

¿Qué nos gustaría ver en tu CV?

Formación Académica: Estudiante en último año o recién graduado de Ingeniería Informática, Estadística, Matemáticas, Economía, ADE o estudiante de masters afines con un enfoque en análisis de datos.

Habilidades Técnicas:


Conocimiento básico o intermedio de Power BI, SQL.
Habilidades de programación: Familiaridad con lenguajes de programación como Python o R, especialmente para el análisis de datos.
Excel avanzado: Análisis de datos, tablas dinámicas, fórmulas complejas y gráficos.



¿Cómo nos gustaría que fueras?


Capacidad para analizar e interpretar datos
Pensamiento crítico y resolución de problemas
Trabajo en equipo
Proactividad y actitud de aprendizaje: Disposición para aprender nuevas tecnologías y metodologías en el campo de BI.
Atención al detalle: Precisión y meticulosidad en el manejo y análisis de datos



Si quieres empezar tu carrera con una oportunidad en el sector académico, ¡Inscríbete!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
En Tenth Revolution somos expertos en consultoría tecnológica y gestión de proyectos IT, con una base de clientes en SAP muy desarrollada.




Para este proyecto, estamos colaborando con la mayor empresa a nivel eruopeo del sector siderúrgico de capital español ubicado en la zona de Barcelona.

Esta compañía industrial con presencia en todo el sur de Europa, Países Nórdicos, Polonia, Francia, Suecia y Reino Unido cuenta con cerca de 10.000 empleados y tiene diversos grupos epresariales con productos de aceros, laminación, plantas de traformacion y recivlaje y empresas de distribución.




Actualmente buscamos un/a consultor Data Analyst con experiencia en Power BI, para incorporarse al equipo de tecnología y sostenibilidad dentro del cliente.




Requisitos:

Experienia trabajando con Power BI.
Excel avanzado.
Capacidad analítica
Power Point
Nivel de inglés mínimo B2.
Soft skills: versátil, con iniciativa propia y, por supuesto, capacidad de análisis.
Vehículo propio.




Funciones principales:

Análisis de datos con Power Bi y con MS Excel para brindar apoyo al departamento.
Colaborar directamente con el equipo de negocio para identificar oportunidades de mejora y apoyar en la implementación de nuevas iniciativas
Participar en proyectos y actividades del Departamento de Sostenibilidad, obteniendo una visión amplia del funcionamiento del área.




Condiciones:

Horario: de 9 a 18h, jornada intensiva los viernes.
Modalidad de trabajo híbrido.
Banda salarial flexible en función de la experiencia y conocimientos.
Contrato indefinido y proyecto estable.
Comedor gratuito
Parking en las instalaciones.




Si te parece interesante, ¿hablamos? p.hernando@tenthrevolution.com

Show more

Si te parece interesante, ¿hablamos? p.hernando@tenthrevolution.com

Title: Analista de datos Jr
Description:

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Desde Grupo Planeta estamos buscando un/a Data Analyst, para nuestra división Planeta Formación y Universidades. La misión es contribuir a la obtención de insights digitales a través del análisis de datos.

¿Cuáles serían tus principales funciones?


Analizar y monitorizar datos para mostrar los KPIs de negocio (tráfico, conversiones,…) y hacer seguimiento y consecución de los objetivos establecidos.
Desarrollar e implementar informes en Looker Studio y GA4.
Asegurar la correcta medición y atribución de tráfico y conversiones web.
Integrar y realizar el set up de las herramientas de analítica digital.
Dar soporte digital analytics a los distintos equipos de la división.
Configurar e implementar guías de etiquetado, píxeles, floodlight, GTM, Server Side.



Requisitos:

¿Qué nos gustaría ver en tu CV?


Formación en Marketing digital, Martech
Experiencia en lectura y validación de guías de etiquetado
Valorable experiencia de al menos 2 años como analista
Experiencia en herramientas de etiquetado (GTM) y de analítica (Google Analytics 4)
Conocimiento de tecnología de visualización de datos (Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau, etc.)
Idiomas: castellano e inglés (B2) valorable francés
Valorable conocimiento de herramientas CRO (A/B Tasty, Optimizely, Clarity, …)
Valorable conocimiento traficado y análisis de campañas (UTMs, Campaign Manager, ...)
Conocimiento de Marketing digital (SEM, Programática, Social Media Paid, SEO, etc.)
Valorable conocimiento en Suite Google Cloud (PubSub, BigQuery, AirFlow)



Encajarías con nosotros/as si te consideras una persona con...


Gran capacidad de análisis
Alta capacidad de relación con clientes



¿Qué ofrecemos?


Contrato estable: Indefinido y a jornada completa.
Podrás desarrollarte profesionalmente gracias a nuestros planes de formación y desarrollo de talento interno.
Descuentos y promociones exclusivas para nuestros empleados (masters y posgrados, sellos editoriales, coleccionables, Casa del Libro…).
Un atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales a través del plan de retribución flexible que incluye: tarjeta transporte, tarjeta restaurante, cheque guardería, seguro médico, etc.



Si crees que es tu oportunidad laboral, ¡Te animamos a inscribirte y formar parte de nuestro equipo!

Title: Data Analyst, Global Insights – Internship
Description:
What You'll Do:

Criteo is in search of a passionate, highly motivated Intern to join our Insights & Marketing Analytics (IMAX) team in Barcelona. The IMAX team is a specialized, global team of insights and analytics professionals located in Barcelona. This global team is responsible for the insights that fuel Criteo-created content; the creation, execution, and analysis of customer, shopper, and marketer surveys; the analysis of Criteo’s own paid media; and the evangelization of data-driven methods and data storytelling across all of Criteo. While the IMAX team directly supports the needs of the global Marketing team, we also interface with commercially-facing teams (such as Sales and Account Strategy), with Criteo clients, and with the marketplace itself via conferences, via the press, and via industry influencers.

You will be working closely with the global Marketing team to create the insights that fuel our message in the marketplace. You will contribute to the analysis behind some of our most important pieces of recurring and ad-hoc thought leadership. You will see your work directly cited in the press, at industry conferences, and by our commercial teams. Examples of such work are available on our website.


Our Travel Reports at https://www.criteo.com/blog/global-travel-industry-trends-2024/
Our ROAS Trap Report at https://go.criteo.com/en/the-roas-trap/
Our Interactive Commerce Dashboard at: https://www.criteo.com/blog/commerce-trends-dashboard/
And many exclusive deliverables for internal teams, clients, analysts and reporters.



You’ll work closely with the IMAX and Content teams to turn Criteo’s extraordinary commerce dataset into market-facing insights. You will also directly support Criteo’s in-house surveys of customers, shoppers, and marketers, on a global basis. You will create, launch, and maintain interactive tools using Tableau (or other technologies) that allow the broader set of global Criteos to access your work at scale.

The position combines traditional technical data analytics work, including the use of SQL, Python, Excel, Tableau, with the “softer” part of data science: storytelling with data.

This position involves dealing with a considerable amount of complex, real-world data and requires a candidate who is comfortable thinking of new and innovative ways to analyze data and solve problems. The ideal candidate will be enthusiastic about data storytelling and embrace the concept of the “full stack” data analytics professional as a career choice.

What you will be doing


Develop automations in Python to increase department efficiency and allow projects to scale
Develop a deep knowledge of how to analyze trends across client, product groups, and verticals in all of Criteo’s global markets
Understand how Criteo creates data across various data stores (Vertica / Hive / Presto). Become a point person regarding the meaning of data and best practices around data access.
Contribute to new ways of using Criteo’s vast storehouse of data, including developing higher quality approaches to existing offerings as well as innovating to create new market-worthy content “from scratch.”
Liaise with other teams as needed, including non-IMAX Analytics, Product Marketing, Sales, and Account Strategy
Work with IMAX and Marketing team members to develop our strategic approach to content. Align our initiatives with Criteo’s overall direction and ensure that IMAX projects contribute to business results.
This role will also provide the opportunity to create custom tables in databases, to support IMAX data for the global Criteo analytics community, to own and maintain reports/code in Tableau, Python or other relevant technologies.



Who You Are:


Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Economics, etc.)
Strong interest in combining analytical/technical skills with softer/communication skills
Strong interest in AI solutions such as ChatGPT,Cursor, Perplexity.
Relevant work experience, with skills being more important than the specific industry
Strong communication skills in English
Strong intellectual curiosity and ability to structure and solve difficult problems with minimal supervision
Understanding of how to extract data from relational databases (i.e. SQL), including data which spans multiple tables
Interest in internet advertising and, more broadly, in Marketing as a discipline.
Knowledge of business intelligence tools: Excel / PivotTables / Tableau
Some experience with Python, in both the context of creating automation and using Python for data analysis and visualization



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Analyst (dpto. fraude)
Description:
Somos una de las entidades financieras de referencia de crédito al consumo en el mercado español. Con 30 años de historia en nuestro país, hemos acompañado a más de dos millones y medio de clientes para hacer realidad sus proyectos.. Estamos respaldados por el grupo Crédit Mutuel, el cuarto banco más importante en Francia, y el holding Argosyn. Ambos nos proporcionan el soporte financiero y tecnológico necesario para diseñar, vender y gestionar una amplia gama de productos de crédito al consumo, préstamos personales, tarjetas, líneas de crédito, soluciones de pago y seguros.




Estamos buscando para nuestra oficina ubicada en Cornellà de Llobregat a un/a Data Analyst. Tu misión consistirá en realizar las extracciones y análisis necesarios, con las herramientas estadísticas existentes, para el control y seguimiento del fraude.




Entre tus funciones y responsabilidades:




Recopilar, limpiar y analizar datos históricos relacionados con el fraude u otros indicadores relevantes relacionados, para identificar patrones de fraude y relaciones entre variables.
Consolidar la información estadística de las bases de datos garantizando la calidad, la fiabilidad y la coherencia del dato con el objetivo de dotar a la Dirección de Fraude herramientas que permitan el análisis de la cartera.
Realización de pruebas y validación rigurosa de los modelos existentes, para asegurar su precisión y fiabilidad; puede incluir validación de datos, pruebas de hipótesis calibración de parámetros y evaluación de precisión predictiva.
Utilizando técnicas estadísticas y matemáticas, participa en el desarrollo de modelos que permiten evaluar y cuantificar el riesgo de fraude.
Dotar al área de estrategias para prevenir el fraude.
Realizar análisis e informes con el objetivo de dar respuesta a las necesidades de información para la realización de estudios tanto en proyectos internos del Grupo como en proyectos de otras direcciones que tengan impacto en la gestión del fraude.




¿Qué buscamos en ti?




Formación universitaria en Matemáticas, Estadística, Economía o Ingenierías.
Experiencia mínima de 3 años como Data Analyst en entidades financieras, preferentemente en el departamento / área de Fraude.
Experiencia participando en proyectos transversales, aportando conocimiento y soluciones desde la perspectiva del fraude.
Conocimiento técnico: SAS o SQL avanzado, Excel avanzado.
Muy valorable conocimiento de herramientas de gestión del fraude (ThreatMetrix,...).
Buen nivel de inglés y/o francés.
Persona con gran capacidad analítica, rigurosa con el dato, credibilidad técnica y buenas habilidades comunicativas para trabajar transversalmente con las áreas y proyectos de Grupo.




¿Qué te ofrecemos?




Incorporarte a una multinacional del sector financiero en pleno proceso de Transformación.
Formar parte de un equipo dinámico formando parte de proyectos transversales.
Amplias posibilidades de desarrollo profesional.
Modelo de trabajo híbrido con 2 días de teletrabajo a la semana.
Un completo paquete de compensación que incluye: contrato estable, salario fijo, variable, tickets restaurant y otros beneficios sociales.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT THE COMPANY

S&P Ventilation Group is a market leading supplier in the field of ventilation solutions. After more than 70 years, the S&P group of companies are serving to more than 90 countries all over the world through different subsidiaries and distributors. The Group is currently employing more than 5.000 people.

S&P Group’s purpose is to innovate by developing ventilation solutions that are energy efficient, easy to install, reliable and durable to ensure air quality in all the indoor spaces that we inhabit.




ABOUT THE JOB

As part of a recently created business analytics department, we are looking for a professional with good technical and analytical skills that will allow us to enhance our capabilities related to the data analysis through Power BI.

The Business analytics department works closely with the different business teams in all related with data analysis, increasing our data accessibility, improving our data visualization, and enabling teams to address the different aspects of the business with more information and obtain better quality insights.

Thus, this person will collaborate with the different business teams, both national and international subsidiaries, to understand the requirements and provide the analytical solutions needed. The role we are seeking to cover requires a proactive and curious profile. Part of the work will require to address new projects, without anything predefined, so it is important to have a wide perspective of the different topics.




WORK-RESPONSABILITIES

·             Develop of KPIs, reports and visualizations through Power BI.

·             Connect to various data sources (e.g., SQL databases, Excel files, APIs) and transform data for analysis.

·             Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI Desktop and Service.

·             Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and address data-related challenges.

·             Provide training and support to users on Power BI tools and best practices.

·             Translate business needs into technical specifications and build scalable, efficient data models.




REQUIRED SKILLS

·                Experience of at least 2 years or more working with Power BI.

·                Knowledge of SQL, data modeling, and business intelligence concepts.

·                Experience in developing and optimizing Power BI dashboards and reports.

·                Experience of data visualization and modelling in Power BI, utilizing a range of in-built and custom capabilities.

·                Excellent English language skills.

·             Provide training and support to users on Power BI tools and best practices.

·             Translate business needs into technical specifications and build scalable, efficient data models.


REQUIRED SKILLS

·                Experience of at least 2 years or more working with Power BI.

·                Knowledge of SQL, data modeling, and business intelligence concepts.

·                Experience in developing and optimizing Power BI dashboards and reports.

·                Experience of data visualization and modelling in Power BI, utilizing a range of in-built and custom capabilities.

·                Excellent English language skills.

Title: RISK/DATA ANALYST ANÁLISIS SECTORIAL Y SEGUIMIENTO DE GRANDES RIESGOS
Description:
Descripción del puesto: ¿Qué proyectos desarrollamos?

 

El departamento de seguimiento de grandes riesgos tiene como principales proyectos y funciones:

 

Análisis de carteras específicas, tanto a nivel cuantitativo como cualitativo, y realizar presentaciones a alto nivel y a órganos supervisores.
es).
Análisis y seguimiento sectorial.
Elaboración información mensual para establecer el perímetro de seguimiento de los grupos/empresas de grandes riesgos, así como, asignar su prioridad.
Extracción de información de triggers para la gestión proactiva de los mismos y seguimiento de acreditados individualmente significativos (Single Nam
Proporcionar información para la previsión escenarios de NPLs para perímetro análisis individual.
Participación en procesos de inspecciones supervisoras. 
Gestión de auditorías externa e interna vinculadas al ámbito de análisis individualizado.
Evaluación y gestión proactiva de cambios regulatorios. Análisis de impacto en la cartera crediticia y colaboración en la implantación de procesos que contribuyan al cumplimiento normativo. 
Dar respuesta a peticiones del supervisor referente a información relacionada con el seguimiento de grandes acreditados.
Seguimiento proyectos con sistemas de información para el mantenimiento, mejoras y desarrollo de nuevos proyectos relacionados con el seguimiento de grandes acreditados, grupos económicos, portfolios y sectores.
Descripción del perfil:

 

Requisitos mínimos

 

Titulación superior en matemáticas, ingeniería informática o ciencias económicas/empresariales.  Se valorará MBA, FRM o similares.
Inglés hablado y escrito
Se valorará experiencia profesional en el ámbito de Riesgos.
Compromiso con la formación y el desarrollo profesional. 
Capacidad de análisis, rigor y síntesis. 
Espíritu crítico, visión global y estratégica del cliente. 
Entusiasmo, compromiso e implicación en el trabajo. 
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo con habilidades de relación interpersonal.

 

Competencias clave

 

Dominio Office: Excel y power point.
Se valorará muy positivamente el uso de herramienta extracción de datos (SAS Enterprise Guide) y conocimientos en Qlik sense.
Conocimientos del ámbito de riesgos y habilidades técnicas para poder entender y gestionar las necesidades asociadas al análisis de carteras de grandes riesgos, así cómo, buen manejo de los datos asociados para llevar a cabo dichos análisis y elaborar presentaciones a alto nivel y a órganos supervisores.
Ofrecemos:

  

Formar parte del Banco más innovador en Europa Occidental 2021 según los premios The Innovators de la revista estadounidense Global Finance.
Desarrollar una carrera profesional interna.
Programa de onboarding y seguimiento de desarrollo profesional, con evaluaciones individuales.
Programa de desarrollo formativo individualizado. Acceso a nuestra plataforma online de formación con un amplio catálogo autoformativo, para que tu aprendizaje sea continúo.
Atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales: seguro de salud, plan de pensiones, ayuda de estudios y condiciones financieras preferentes.
Retribución flexible aplicada a transporte, formación, idiomas, entre otros.
Medidas de flexibilidad

Title: Business Analytics
Description:
En Toyota Material Handling, no solo movemos mercancías, “We move the world” ¿te gustaría formar parte de una compañía líder en manipulación de materiales? ¡Tenemos una oportunidad para ti!

Toyota Material Handling, la división del grupo Toyota dedicada al sector industrial, está buscando profesionales con talento como tú, para unirse a nuestro equipo en España de más de 600 empleados. Nuestros productos y soluciones, desde carretillas elevadoras hasta avanzados proyectos de automatización logística, maximizan la eficiencia de nuestros clientes.

Trabajamos en estrecha colaboración con el resto de la organización en Europa, en un entorno laboral excepcional centrado tanto en la satisfacción del cliente como en el desarrollo personal y profesional de nuestro equipo. En este sentido, nuestro compromiso se refleja en la formación continua y la promoción interna

¿Te imaginas trabajando en una compañía que valora la calidad de su equipo y está dispuesta a ayudarte a alcanzar tus metas? ¡No busques más! Haz tu Smart Move y únete a Toyota Material Handling.Te ofrecemos el entorno perfecto para desarrollar tus habilidades y crecer profesionalmente.

¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?


Análisis y control de los resultados / consecución de los objetivos de ventas
Cálculo de objetivos & colaboración en el desarrollo de focos estratégicos de la compañía
Interpretación de datos, señalización de tendencias de mercado/negocio
Soporte a Directores de Ventas en toma de decisiones
Tracking de costes y su evolución
Trabajar en la mejora de los focos estratégicos de la compañía
Liderazgo de proyectos enfocados en la mejora de la eficiencia de la organización comercial
Confección y análisis de KPI’s de ventas
Soporte al personal técnico comercial de la Red de Ventas
Preparación y control de Campañas Comerciales
Gestión y colaboración en proyectos de mejora a nivel de Dirección Comercial
Cálculo de costes y contribución en pedidos y operaciones especiales del Departamento (Business Case)
Gestión, coordinación y seguimiento de reuniones departamentales


Eres tú si....


Capacidad de organización y priorización.
Comprensión de entornos complejos de datos, conceptos financieros y de negocio.
Proactivo, autónomo y toma de decisiones.
Comunicación interna y externa.
Polivalencia.
Project Management: gestión de proyectos.
Orientación a logro y objetivos.
Mejora continua (LEAN): mejora de procesos dentro de una organización.


¿Qué otros requisitos debes cumplir?


Licenciado/Diplomado Universitario.
Más de 1 año de experiencia relacionada (Business Controlling, Data Research Analyst, Finance).
Valorable experiencia en desarrollo de negocio.
Ofimáticos: Nivel Avanzado paquete Office 365 (Teams, Power Bi, Excel). Manejo ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning). Manejo de Macros recomendable.
Idiomas: Inglés Alto.


¿Qué ofrecemos?


Jornada flexible.
Retribución flexible.
Posibilidades reales de crecimiento profesional en la empresa.
Formación continua en negocio, producto y rol.
Buen paquete retributivo con fijo competitivo y bonus atractivo.
Descuentos en la marca Toyota & Lexus
Incorporación estable en empresa líder en su sector.


Si tras leer la posición, consideras que tu perfil encaja con el puesto no dudes en enviarnos tu CV actualizado. Nos pondremos en contacto contigo en la mayor brevedad posible.

Toyota Material Handling España tiene un plan de igualdad, las candidaturas de cualquier género serán bienvenida

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (100% remote in Poland or Spain)
Description:
Welcome to the good side of tech 👋


You might have heard about us, but with a different name: Doctoralia. It all started 10 years ago, when we asked ourselves: is anyone in healthcare thinking about patients? We jumped in and we empowered patients by giving them access to leave and read reviews about their visit. We then provided doctors with the technology to manage bookings easily and save time, so they could devote themselves to what they always wanted: treating patients. And today is the day in which we ask you: will you join us in the next step of making the healthcare experience more human?


Docplanner at scale


We are leaders in 13 countries so far, and more than 90 million patients trust us every month. Almost 300.000 specialists believe in us and our product, and so do leading venture capital funds such as Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Asset Management and One Peak Partners. And yet, employing over 2.700 people all over the globe, we managed to keep the startup-mindset we started with over 10 years ago.




Job Description



Our primary objective is to assist business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing global reports as the primary and most reliable source of information. A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.


How would you be impacting our mission?


Derive facts from data and translate them into actionable insights and recommendations.
Support the business with identifying opportunities and making intelligent, data-driven decisions. You will execute end-to-end BI projects and be the main point of contact for the internal stakeholders.
Use (and develop!) a global database.
Create, automate and visualize reports and analysis for both top management and local teams (such as Finance, Sales, Customer Success, Marketing, Customer Experience).
When you become independent in the role you will have a chance to develop prediction/classification models using Python/R.
Work with Redshift, Git, Tableau, Airflow daily.



Qualifications



What will help you thrive?


Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights, either in commercial or academic setting (must have).
Knowledge of Python/R and desire to expand your knowledge.
Experience with statistical modeling and descriptive statistics.
Experience in partnership with internal stakeholders.
Experience in leading and executing end to end BI projects.
Very good level of business English.

Which skills are ‘bonus points’?


Have a degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Are able to take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens.
Are open to cooperating with a lot of people from many teams in different countries.
Like to see instant effects of your work.
Are careful, diligent and detail-oriented.



Additional Information



What will you get in return?


Let’s talk money


Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings;
Share options plan after 6 months of working with us.

True flexibility and work-life balance


Remote first in one of our legal entities or hybrid work model in one of our office locations;
Flexible working hours;
Paid time off according to your location of work;
Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).

Health comes first


Health insurance according to your location of work;
Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.

What does the recruitment process look like?


A 30-minute meeting with Rosario Corti - Head of International Talent Acquisition
A 60-minute meeting with Wiktor Kulikowski - BI Manager
Business Case - Prepare a Business Case and present it within the final chat (60 minutes) with Wiktor

We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you’re reading, there’s a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we’re lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you’ve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other.


“We believe all humans, in all their beautiful diversity, should have equal rights, dignity and respect. Period.” Mariusz Gralewski, CEO

Title: Consultant Data Analyst
Description:
Estamos en búsqueda de un Consultant / Data Analyst con experiencia en análisis de datos y gestión de proyectos para incorporarse a nuestro equipo de **Unified AI. Este perfil liderará proyectos de análisis de datos para clientes, diseñando soluciones innovadoras y colaborando en un entorno dinámico y altamente tecnológico.




Funciones:

- Gestión de proyectos de análisis de datos: Liderar la comunicación directa con los clientes y gestionar sus desarrollos en análisis de datos.

- Colaboración en desarrollos técnicos: Usar herramientas como Power BI, SQL y Python para diseñar soluciones eficaces y a medida para los clientes.

- Diseño de soluciones: Interpretar requerimientos y diseñar soluciones tecnológicas que optimicen los procesos del cliente.

- Liderazgo de equipo: Tras los primeros meses, liderar a un pequeño equipo, impulsando su desarrollo profesional y garantizando la calidad de los proyectos.

 

Requisitos esenciales:

- Experiencia profesional mínima de 3 años en consultoría, gestión de proyectos o sectores afines. 

- Experiencia en trato directo con clientes y participación en equipos multidisciplinares. Conocimientos en herramientas de Business Intelligence y gestión de bases de datos.

- Preferible residencia en Barcelona o alrededores. 

- Grado en Ingeniería Informática, ADE o formación equivalente. Se valorarán másteres, postgrados o bootcamps relacionados con análisis de datos y liderazgo.

- Conocimientos técnicos: Power BI, SQL y Python son imprescindibles.

- Familiaridad con otras herramientas de Business Intelligence como ClickView/ClickSense.

- Idiomas: Castellano y catalán nativos, inglés B2 o C1. 

- Orientación al cliente, capacidad de liderazgo y ganas de aprender en un entorno tecnológico en constante evolución.




Ofrecemos:

- Modelo de trabajo híbrido con 80% remoto (4 días en remoto y 1 presencial a la semana).


- Contrato indefinido, con incorporación inmediata.

- Crecimiento profesional: oportunidad de liderar un equipo y desarrollarte en el campo de inteligencia artificial y análisis de datos.

Show more

- Colaboración en desarrollos técnicos: Usar herramientas como Power BI, SQL y Python para diseñar soluciones eficaces y a medida para los clientes.

- Diseño de soluciones: Interpretar requerimientos y diseñar soluciones tecnológicas que optimicen los procesos del cliente.

- Liderazgo de equipo: Tras los primeros meses, liderar a un pequeño equipo, impulsando su desarrollo profesional y garantizando la calidad de los proyectos.

 

Requisitos esenciales:

- Experiencia profesional mínima de 3 años en consultoría, gestión de proyectos o sectores afines. 

- Experiencia en trato directo con clientes y participación en equipos multidisciplinares. Conocimientos en herramientas de Business Intelligence y gestión de bases de datos.

- Preferible residencia en Barcelona o alrededores. 

- Grado en Ingeniería Informática, ADE o formación equivalente. Se valorarán másteres, postgrados o bootcamps relacionados con análisis de datos y liderazgo.

- Conocimientos técnicos: Power BI, SQL y Python son imprescindibles.

- Familiaridad con otras herramientas de Business Intelligence como ClickView/ClickSense.

- Idiomas: Castellano y catalán nativos, inglés B2 o C1. 

- Orientación al cliente, capacidad de liderazgo y ganas de aprender en un entorno tecnológico en constante evolución.


Ofrecemos:

- Modelo de trabajo híbrido con 80% remoto (4 días en remoto y 1 presencial a la semana).

- Contrato indefinido, con incorporación inmediata.

- Crecimiento profesional: oportunidad de liderar un equipo y desarrollarte en el campo de inteligencia artificial y análisis de datos.

Title: Rev-celerator Graduate Programme: Data Analyst
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 45+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product teams and deliver rock star solutions.

About The Rev-Celerator Graduate Programme 🎓

Are you a recent graduate eager to shape the future of finance? Ready to make a meaningful impact and bring innovative ideas to life? Well, the Rev-celerator Graduate Software Engineer programme is designed just for you.

First, kick off with a few weeks of bootcamp, where we’ll prepare you to jump into work at Revolut with workshops, lectures, and practical exercises to start developing your skills. After successful preparation, we’ll launch you into on-the-job training where you’ll be face-to-face with tough challenges, problem-solving, and tasks to own.

The Rev-celerator Graduate Programme is now open to international candidates willing to relocate to one of our tech hubs in Poland, Portugal, and Spain. Get support on visa application (if needed), relocation costs, and the first month of accommodation.

We’re looking for a Data Analyst who doesn’t believe there’s a data task that can be too hard. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process, they never stop learning, picking up new skills, and delivering value ✨

Unlock your potential, explore new horizons, and step into the future of finance.

Up for the challenge? Let's get in touch 🚀

What You’ll Be Doing


Participating in a specialist bootcamp, gaining visibility over multiple department projects across Revolut
Working to build analytical tools and machine learning models, such as dashboards and ETLs, for upcoming product launches
Helping increase visibility in sign-up processes and operational funnels
Maintaining and enhancing existing data infrastructure, including ETLs and LookML code, to ensure data accessibility and usability
Collaborating with stakeholders from Operations, Growth, and Product teams to refine features and uncover new insights
Supporting business needs with ad-hoc data analysis, including interest rate sensitivity, salary incentive profitability, and payments conversion rates
Learning from industry leaders and participating in weekly meetings to stay aligned with team priorities
Managing project tasks, tracking progress, and communicating key outcomes
Sharing updates about your work with our diverse global teams
Attending regular performance reviews to receive feedback and guide your development


What You'll Need


A 2:1 predicted or achieved grade (or above)
To have graduated university in 2023, 2024, or 2025
University studies in computer science, maths, physics, or a similar field
Great skills with Python and SQL
Evidence of solid mathematical and statistics knowledge
A portfolio of multiple coding side projects or open source contributions
A proactive attitude
A love for problem-solving
Fluency in English
To be a quick learner
An ambitious and results-driven personality
Excellent communication and organisational skills
To feel comfortable working as part of a diverse team in a dynamic environment


Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: SQL Data Analyst
Description:
As an SQL Data Analyst/Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining SQL-based data solutions to support our business intelligence and data analytics initiatives. This role requires a strong understanding of SQL Server technologies, data integration tools, and reporting/analytics platforms.

 

Technical Skills

SQL expert, complex querying and also experience in maintaining and deploying databases,

Solid Python knowledge.

Java is a plus but not essential

Power BI and Excel: Expert in Power BI, particularly in creating and managing datasets.

Experience in data modeling for analytics.

Familiarity with predictive models

Good understanding of Data Architecture.

Experience with Azure products.

Clear experience in data science and data analysis rather than just familiarity or buzzwords.

Experience with Databricks and other advanced data processing platforms.

 

The key elements resource should have:

SQL Development: Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database objects to support reporting and data analysis requirements.
Data Integration: Utilize SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to design and implement ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.
Data Analysis: Develop and maintain SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) multidimensional and tabular models to enable complex data analysis and reporting.
Reporting and Visualization: Create and manage Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.
Databricks: Leverage Databricks for big data processing and analytics, integrating it with SQL-based solutions as needed.
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schema designs to support reporting and analytics requirements.
Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient data processing and query execution.
Collaboration: Work closely with business users and IT teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, data models, and reporting solutions.

 

Technical Skills:

SQL Server: Proficiency in SQL Server (2008 and above) including T-SQL, SSIS, and SSAS.
Data Modeling: Experience with tabular models and multidimensional cube development in SSAS.
Power BI: Expertise in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards.
Databricks: Familiarity with Databricks for big data analytics and integration.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Project Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, delivering high-quality results within deadlines

 

Certifications Needed:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.

Title: Controller Financiero/a y Analista de Datos
Description:
El/La candidato/a se responsabilizará de la preparación de informes financieros, la gestión de presupuestos y la implementación de controles internos para asegurar la precisión y la integridad de la información financiera. El/la controller financiero trabaja estrechamente con la alta dirección para apoyar la toma de decisiones estratégicas y garantizar la estabilidad financiera de la organización.




Responsabilidades Principales:




Planificación Financiera y Presupuestaria:




Realizar análisis de variaciones presupuestarias y proponer acciones correctivas.




Informes Financieros:




Preparar estados financieros mensuales, trimestrales y anuales.
Análisis de les diferencies en los reportings financieros, explicación y plan de acción y seguimiento del mismo.




Análisis Financiero:




Realizar análisis financieros detallados para apoyar la toma de decisiones.
Evaluar la rentabilidad de proyectos y propuestas de inversión.
Identificar y analizar tendencias financieras, riesgos y oportunidades.




Control Interno y Cumplimiento:




Implementar y mantener sistemas de control interno efectivos.
Asegurar el cumplimiento de políticas financieras internas y regulaciones externas.
Participar en auditorías internas y externas, y gestionar la implementación de recomendaciones.




Requisitos del Puesto:




Formación:




Título universitario en Contabilidad, Finanzas, Economía o campos relacionados.
Deseable un máster en Finanzas, MBA o certificaciones profesionales.
Conocimientos en automatización de procesos financieros utilizando scripts de Python.
Excel avanzado, incluyendo el uso tablas dinámicas y modelado financiero complejo (uso de Power Query valorado).







Experiencia:




Mínimo de 5 a 7 años de experiencia en roles financieros, preferiblemente en control financiero o auditoría.
Experiencia en el manejo y análisis de grandes volúmenes de datos mediante el uso de bases de datos (Access, SQL, u otros sistemas relacionados).
Experiencia en la integración de sistemas ERP con herramientas de análisis de datos para mejorar la eficiencia y precisión de los reportes financieros.







Conocimientos y Habilidades Técnicas:




Experiencia en el manejo y análisis de grandes volúmenes de datos mediante el uso de bases de datos (Access, SQL, u otros sistemas relacionados).
Conocimientos en automatización de procesos financieros utilizando scripts de Python.
Excel avanzado, incluyendo el uso tablas dinámicas y modelado financiero complejo (uso de Power Query valorado).
Familiaridad con herramientas de visualización de datos como Power BI o similares.
Experiencia en la integración de sistemas ERP con herramientas de análisis de datos para mejorar la eficiencia y precisión de los reportes financieros.
Capacidad para desarrollar y optimizar procesos automatizados que reduzcan errores y mejoren la eficiencia en la elaboración de informes financieros.
Orientación a la innovación tecnológica y mejora continua en el ámbito financiero.
Conocimiento profundo de principios contables y normativas fiscales.
Dominio de software financiero y de contabilidad puesto que se trabaja con gran volumen de datos. (ERP, Excel, etc.).
Nivel de ingles medio-alto (ser capaz de hacer reportings en inglés de y de explicarlos)
Capacidad para trabajar bajo presión y cumplir con plazos estrictos.
Acostumbrado/a a trabajar con varios departamentos. el candidato/a estará en estrecha colaboración con el controllers industrial y con el director financiero.
Deseable conocimientos de controlling industrial e involucración en el departamento administrativo financiero.




Competencias:




Pensamiento analítico y estratégico.
Orientación a resultados y atención al detalle.
Habilidad para resolver problemas y tomar decisiones.
Integridad y ética profesional.
Trabajo en equipo

  • Integridad y ética profesional.
  • Trabajo en equipo

Title: BI Analyst Intern
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Global Reporting Team's mission is to identify, define, produce, and automate sales/business/finance performance reporting portfolio. As the scope of the GRT is so wide, this is a unique opportunity not only to develop your technical skills, but also to learn more about different areas of our business and make an impact, while working in a fast paced environment.

Criteo and our stakeholders are constantly finding new ways to innovate, and our reporting suite is critical for tracking progress. As an intern, alongside the rest of the team you will be responsible for :


Working with stakeholder to analyze and understand their business needs to translate them into technical requirements
Building, running and updating existing reports based on the company needs and transformations
Exploring, validating and fixing data issues to provide high quality service to Criteos
Maintaining and improving processes (specification, procedures, and user training material).



Our objective is that by the end of the internship, you have developed the skills and experience to work in data.

Who You Are:


Degree from a business or quantitative field
Experience in Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, etc.), PowerPoint, SQL, and BI restitution tools such Power BI (or equivalent)
Must be eager to learn, proactive and analytical
Excellent communication skills in English (spoken and written)
You are versatile, self-driven, detail-oriented, and hands-on
You value teamwork and building rapport with individuals
You have a demonstrated interest in Internet and technology



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

You're an original. So are we.

We're a company of people who like to forge our own path. We invented the blue jean in 1873, and we reinvented khaki pants in 1986. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines in manufacturing. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do. Our brands stand for freedom and self-expression around the world.

Where we lead, others follow. For more than 160 years, we've used the strength of our brands to lead with our values and make an outsized impact on the world. We employ more than 15,000 people globally to support our great brands: Levi's®, Dockers®, Denizen®, Signature by Levi Strauss & Co.™ and Beyond Yoga.

About The Job

Levi’s is looking for a seasoned Analyst and Data Visualization Expert to support the data science and analytics team focused on Direct To Consumer data products. The ideal candidate is a great storyteller and strong technical contributor who has experience solving business problems with data-driven tools. You will be responsible for delivering a suite of analytical products including analyses, dashboards, insights, and recommendations with especial focus on clickstream data. You will collect, analyze, and present data to improve strategic decision making and to track the benefits unlocked by the data products. You should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. You should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.


Conduct analysis to estimate expected value of data products. Measure and track benefits created by data products, and convert them to financial or key KPI metrics
Support business stakeholders and regional data analysts by understanding their needs and providing guidance and support.
Create dashboards to track adoption and business impact of features and data product launched.
Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on digital features and AI model performance through hypothesis testing. Partner with cross functional teams on implementation.
Partner with data science, data analytics and product managers on planning, goal setting and prioritization.
Partner with data and engineering teams to improve instrumentation and product/models health reporting, pre/post analysis and business debugging.
Partner with A/B test team to design experiments and post-hoc analysis of results.
Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.
Promote a culture of data driven technical excellence, ownership, collaboration.


About You


3+ years of professional experience analyzing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
3+ years of applied data visualization experience. Tableau and PowerBI as main visualization tools.
3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Amazon Redshift, Oracle, Google BigQuery).
Coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarize, and analyze data.
Hands on experience working with big data, ideally clickstream data, in big data volume sectors such as ecommerce, gaming, social network etc. ecommerce platforms are a plus.
Ability to translate and present complex analysis in executive summaries. Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills.
Strong problem solving skills.
Bachelor's in economics, Statistics, Data, Data Science and Engineering (Masters is a plus) or equivalent experience.


LOCATION

Barcelona, Spain

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.
Show more

Title: Rev-celerator Internship Programme: Data Analyst
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 45+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product teams and deliver rock star solutions.

About The Rev-celerator Internship Programme 🎓

If you’re in your penultimate year of study, this one’s for you. You’ll work with us for 3 months and get to know everything we do.

First, kick off with a few weeks of bootcamp, where we’ll prepare you to jump into work at Revolut with workshops, lectures, and practical exercises to develop your skills. After a successful preparation, we’ll launch you into on-the-job training. At this stage, you’ll be face-to-face with tough challenges, problem-solving, and tasks to own.

We’re looking for a Data Analyst who doesn’t believe there’s a data task that can be too hard. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process, they never stop learning, picking up new skills, and delivering value ✨

Up for the challenge? Let's get in touch 🚀

What You’ll Be Doing


Participating in a specialist bootcamp, gaining visibility over multiple department projects across Revolut
Working to build analytical tools and machine learning models, such as dashboards and ETLs, for upcoming product launches
Helping increase visibility in sign-up processes and operational funnels
Maintaining and enhancing existing data infrastructure, including ETLs and LookML code, to ensure data accessibility and usability
Collaborating with stakeholders from Operations, Growth, and Product teams to refine products and uncover new insights
Supporting business needs with ad-hoc data analysis, including interest rate sensitivity, salary incentive profitability, and payments conversion rates
Learning from industry leaders and participating in weekly meetings to stay aligned with team priorities
Managing project tasks, tracking progress, and communicating key outcomes
Sharing updates about your work with our diverse global teams
Attending regular performance reviews to receive feedback and guide your development


What You'll Need


To currently be in penultimate year of a bachelor’s or master’s degree in a relevant field, such as engineering, computer science, maths, physics, or a similar field
Great skills with Python and SQL
Evidence of solid mathematical and statistics knowledge
A portfolio of multiple coding side projects or open source contributions
A proactive attitude
A love for problem-solving
Fluency in English
To be a quick learner
An ambitious and results-driven personality
Excellent communication and organisational skills
To feel comfortable working as part of a diverse team in a dynamic environment
To be able to travel to a Revolut office in your country of employment (hybrid working)
Full-time availability for the programme (summer 2025)


Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.


Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Regional Operations - Africa (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

As a Sr Analyst, Regional Operations you will work as a goalkeeper of the main operational metrics (Delivery time, efficiency, Cost per order…). This role will require a mix of analytical skills, operations, stakeholder management, and creativity to tackle different challenges. We offer a challenging and dynamic environment with many opportunities for learning and development.

THE JOURNEY


Analyze data obsessively to identify trends and build successful implementation strategies for our on-demand operations.
Evaluate strategic opportunities, performing a broad range of quantitative and qualitative analyses.
Monitor and track the metrics on a weekly basis and together with each of the country Head of Operations come up with plans to address deviations.
You will combine advanced analytical data insights with business understanding and market knowledge.
Work very close with local teams, to ensure the best in class operations in the region.
Travel often to gain insights into local realities, build relationships with the local operations team, and understand the local challenges firsthand.
Collaborate with teams across all levels to ensure we deliver the best product for each country.
Give life to your craziest ideas and have an immediate impact thinking out of the box!


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or related field.
2+ years experience in a data analytics role. Experience in Operations, tech, or marketplace-related businesses is a plus.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Proficiency in SQL and Excel are a must; Python is a plus.
Ability to engage internal and external stakeholders through excellent communication skills.
Fluency in English is a must.
Willing to travel to exciting African countries.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence
Description:
En Palatin conectamos profesionales con nuevas oportunidades.




Nuestro cliente, una empresa internacional, está buscando un especialista en BI y Analítica de Datos para unirse a su departamento de Producto y Tecnología en su sede de Badalona.




La persona seleccionada será clave para impulsar nuestros proyectos de datos y analítica de negocio, desarrollando nuevos paneles de Business Intelligence (BI) en proyectos a medida.




Ubicación: Badalona, España. Modelo presencial.
Modelo: Contrato indefinido.




Responsabilidades:

Desarrollar proyectos de datos e incorporar herramientas ETL para gestionar la información entre sistemas.
Implementar, dar soporte y gestionar bases de datos analíticas.
Promover el uso de herramientas BI en toda la organización.
Desarrollar paneles de BI multipropósito y personalizables.
Revisar, modernizar y optimizar los actuales paneles BI.
Formar a usuarios internos en el uso de los paneles BI desarrollados.




Requisitos:

A partir de 3 años en posiciones similares, y conocimiento de herramientas de Azure Data Factory o Azure Synapse. Microsoft Power BI y Azure SQL.
Experiencia con herramientas cloud y metodologías ágiles.
Conocimientos en manejo de datos con Python.
CFGS o Graduado en Ciencias informáticas, Estádistica, Economía, Matemáticas o similar, muy valora certificación oficial en Microsoft Power BI (PL-300) o Data Engineering.




Si estás buscando una nueva oportunidad para desarrollar tu carrera en un entorno innovador y dinámico, ¡esta es tu oportunidad!




Comparte tu CV con nosotros.
