Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
About DataCamp

DataCamp's mission is to empower everyone with the data and AI skills essential for 21st-century success. By providing practical, engaging learning experiences, DataCamp equips learners and organizations of all sizes to harness the power of data and AI. As a trusted partner to over 14 million learners and 5,000+ companies, including 80% of the Fortune 1000, DataCamp is leading the charge in addressing the critical data and AI skills shortage.

About the role

As a (Senior) Product Data Analyst at DataCamp, you will play a pivotal role in building and maintaining world-class client reporting capabilities. Reporting to the Director of Analytics, you will ensure that our customers understand the value of our platform by making it easy for them to accurately track how their users are leveraging and improving their skills using DataCamp. You'll be deeply involved in working with the product and customer success teams to optimize our client reporting portal, data connectors (APIs), and internal dashboards.

You will influence changes by bringing data to the table and promoting data-driven development and decision-making. To be successful, you will need to collaborate with a strong team of software engineers, data scientists, data engineers, product managers, and customer success leaders. You will get to do all of this while leveraging DataCamp's rich data and state-of-the-art data science infrastructure.

About you

At DataCamp, we seek individuals who embody our core values of data-driven decision-making, action, transparency, ownership, and customer focus. You thrive in a fast-paced, high-performing environment and are driven by a passion for making a meaningful impact. You're adaptable, embracing change and ambiguity with enthusiasm. Your initiative and entrepreneurial spirit push you beyond just meeting targets—you aim to understand the "why" behind our goals and take ownership to drive the business forward. You're a collaborative team player who values transparency and always seeks to improve and innovate. If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply!

Responsibilities


Perform analyses on how our external and internal B2B clients use our reporting tools and services, providing improvement recommendations to the product management team.
Generate and maintain comprehensive internal reports and dashboards for the customer success team to monitor and identify opportunities for our clients.
Ensure high data quality standards by maintaining accuracy and consistency across internal dashboards and client product reporting tools.
Keep our internal documentation, like data dictionaries, up to date and continuously provide recommendations on existing and new metric definitions to ensure our customers can easily use and find value in the data we provide.
Partner with the customer success and learning solutions teams to work on key accounts by attending meetings to help gather requirements, explain our data and present insights to customers.
Mentor and support team members in analytics best practices, raising the analytics IQ of the customer success and product teams.


Qualifications


Has 3+ years of experience in product, client reporting analytics or a related field.
Has strong storytelling skills with a track record of presenting to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Is highly skilled in SQL and has 2+ years of experience using BI Tools (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc.).
Can easily connect analytics solutions to business outcomes.
Has strong problem-solving skills, with an ability to come to rigorous and defensible solutions to complex and open-ended problems.
Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills.
Has a passion for DataCamp's mission of data and AI literacy.


Why Datacamp?

Joining DataCamp means becoming part of a dynamic, creative, and international start-up. Here are just a few of the reasons why you'll love being on our team:


Exciting challenges: Face new technical challenges daily, keeping your work engaging and rewarding.
Competitive compensation: We offer a competitive salary with attractive benefits.
Flexibility: Benefit from flexible working hours because the future is flexible!
Continuous learning: Access a yearly learning budget for conferences & training to support your professional growth.
Global retreats: Participate in international company retreats, fostering a global team spirit.
Equipment: Yearly refreshment of your IT Equipment budget for your home working setup.
Amazing team: Collaborate with a truly exceptional team—seriously, we're awesome!


Our competitive compensation package offers additional benefits. On top of your salary you will also receive extra legal benefits such as best-in-class medical insurance including dental and vision. Depending on your location additional benefits might be available to you.

At DataCamp, we value diverse experiences and perspectives. If you're excited about this role but don't meet every qualification, we still encourage you to apply. We believe skills can be developed and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. Your unique talents and perspectives are what make our team great!

Title: Rev-celerator Internship Programme: Data Analyst
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 45+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product teams and deliver rock star solutions.

About The Rev-celerator Internship Programme 🎓

If you’re in your penultimate year of study, this one’s for you. You’ll work with us for 3 months and get to know everything we do.

First, kick off with a few weeks of bootcamp, where we’ll prepare you to jump into work at Revolut with workshops, lectures, and practical exercises to develop your skills. After a successful preparation, we’ll launch you into on-the-job training. At this stage, you’ll be face-to-face with tough challenges, problem-solving, and tasks to own.

We’re looking for a Data Analyst who doesn’t believe there’s a data task that can be too hard. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process, they never stop learning, picking up new skills, and delivering value ✨

Up for the challenge? Let's get in touch 🚀

What You’ll Be Doing


Participating in a specialist bootcamp, gaining visibility over multiple department projects across Revolut
Working to build analytical tools and machine learning models, such as dashboards and ETLs, for upcoming product launches
Helping increase visibility in sign-up processes and operational funnels
Maintaining and enhancing existing data infrastructure, including ETLs and LookML code, to ensure data accessibility and usability
Collaborating with stakeholders from Operations, Growth, and Product teams to refine products and uncover new insights
Supporting business needs with ad-hoc data analysis, including interest rate sensitivity, salary incentive profitability, and payments conversion rates
Learning from industry leaders and participating in weekly meetings to stay aligned with team priorities
Managing project tasks, tracking progress, and communicating key outcomes
Sharing updates about your work with our diverse global teams
Attending regular performance reviews to receive feedback and guide your development


What You'll Need


To currently be in penultimate year of a bachelor’s or master’s degree in a relevant field, such as engineering, computer science, maths, physics, or a similar field
Great skills with Python and SQL
Evidence of solid mathematical and statistics knowledge
A portfolio of multiple coding side projects or open source contributions
A proactive attitude
A love for problem-solving
Fluency in English
To be a quick learner
An ambitious and results-driven personality
Excellent communication and organisational skills
To feel comfortable working as part of a diverse team in a dynamic environment
To be able to travel to a Revolut office in your country of employment (hybrid working)
Full-time availability for the programme (summer 2025)


Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.


Show more

That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Fleet Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Job Description

Join Us to Shape the Future of Mobility!

Ready to make a difference? Join our ambitious Lisbon team and enhance our fleet’s cost efficiency. We’re looking for a hands-on expert to drive analytics in our “Fleet Steering & Systems” team. Your role: ensure quality data, collaborate with business leaders for insights, implement smart reporting, and support automated decisions across our operations.

DO WHAT YOU LOVE:


Lead a key focus area in our fleet analytics team, managing data for over 100,000 vehicles across Europe.
Impact business decisions with short decision paths, working directly with VPs and cross-functional leaders.
Recommend optimal technical solutions to enhance analytics and ensure a data-driven advantage.
Benefit from 360° development, gaining a holistic view of fleet management and learning from our Lisbon data science community.
Collaborate with innovative colleagues in Lisbon and Munich.


Qualifications

COME AS YOU ARE:


Driven and ready to take full ownership in a dynamic environment where trust and responsibility go hand in hand.
Experienced in analytics, with strong skills in SQL and AWS Quicksight.
Passionate about the mobility industry with relevant experience.


Additional Information

YOUR BENEFITS:

Working at SIXT not only means creating the future of mobility, but also offers personal benefits. This means especially for you: 28days of vacation, no dress code, a hybrid working model andflexible working hours.In our modern office,with new equipment, you can stock up on coffee at any time and spend your lunch break with colleagues in the on-site restaurantthat provides healthy and delicious food for everyone.

Moreover, we offer you a super international working environment, numerous trainingsfor your individual development, participation in external conferences and we even organize internal dev & tech talks. It is very important to us that you can develop personally and grow within our company.

Furthermore, you can benefit from our Coverflexadvantage system. With this system you can selectthe benefits you want- This way you can decide for yourself what you want to use your benefits for!

In addition, your colleagues are pretty awesome. Which is important when you spend so much time together, and besides, no wonder when you get a bonus for referring friends as new employees. Otherwise, we live "work hard, play hard" - our parties are legendary! We also demand and promote DiverSIXTy, a corporate culture of acceptance, appreciation, and respect, in which everyone can develop their personality and ideas.

About us:

We are a leading global mobility service provider with sales of €3.07 billion and around 9,000 employees worldwide. Our mobility platform ONE combines our products SIXT rent (car rental), SIXT share (car sharing), SIXT ride (cab, driver and chauffeur services), SIXT+ (car subscription) and gives our customers access to our fleet of 222,000 vehicles, the services of 1,500 cooperation partners and around 1.5 million drivers worldwide. Together with our franchise partners, we are present in more than 110 countries at 2,098 rental stations. At SIXT, a first-class customer experience and outstanding customer service are our top priorities. We focus on true entrepreneurship and long-term stability and align our corporate strategy with foresight. Want to take off with us and revolutionize the world of mobility? Apply now!

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Descrição da empresa

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum’s team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum’s solutions aim at contributing to its clients’ performance and innovation as well as the common good. Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility. Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Descrição do emprego

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Inetum Team and be part of a work culture focused on innovation!

Location: Lisbon

Main Responsibilities

  • Lead dashboard projects from End to End in cyber security risk management;
  • Collect, analyze, and interpret data sets to create visual representations that support decision making;
  • Work with the other departments within Cyber to identify business needs, design effective data models, develop and maintain dashboards;
  • ...

Profile

  • Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or similar;
  • +3 years of experience in data analytics and dashboard development;
  • Professional experience with Tableau, Power BI and Dataiku;
  • Strong experience with PostgreSQL and ETL tools;
  • Experience with Azure Cloud;
  • Excellent communication skills;
  • Team work driven;
  • Fluent English;
  • French B1/B2;
  • Hybrid work - office in Lisbon (1/2x per week).

Send your CV & join our team!

Title: Full Stack Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of €1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let’s fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

We are looking for a talented data analyst with data science skills, expertise in ETL and DataViz solutions. You will lead dashboard projects from End-to-End in cyber security risk management, collect, analyze, and interpret data sets to create visual representations that provide information and support data-based decision making.

Also, the candidate will work closely with the other departments and entities within Cyber to identify business needs, design effective data models, develop and maintain dashboards using PowerBI, Tableau, Dataiku and PostgreSQL for data processing and analysis.


Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related subject. 
+3 years of experience as data Analyst, developing Dashboard and DataViz.
Knowledge of algorithms is a plus and will enable the candidate to be a force for proposing useful content related to cyber security risk management.
Expertise with PowerBI, Tableau, Dataiku, PostgreSQL and ETL tools (e.g., Tableau Certified Data Analyst, Dataiku Advanced Designer Certificate).
Experience with other data visualization tools such as PowerBI.
Basic Python skills.


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: STDA Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Stress Testing Data Analytics (STDA) team has a key role to play in the development of a strong risk management framework for the BNP Paribas Group. The team is responsible for the elaboration of the dataset that will be used as the starting point for modelling activities and stress testing exercises, which are crucial in granting the Group means to anticipate risks
The team works on a Big Data environment, with access to an ecosystem of Hadoop tools including Spark and Hive. Dataiku DSS (Data Science Studio) is used as an end-user interface, providing a visual approach to the implementation of ETL (Extract Transform Load) pipelines. Data visualization is also a part of the team's responsibilities, with Tableau as the main tool
The team works in partnership with the IT department of the Group regarding the stress-testing platform. They support the team on a daily-basis and help with back-end big data engineering support and maintenance
In this role, you will join the team dedicated to credit risk. Your primary responsibility will be to handle big data, perform in-depth data analysis, present data to see beyond the numbers and prepare the databases used for the projection of credit risk parameters for stress testing and IFRS 9

Your Main Activities Are


Execute data collection, data ingestion, data quality, data preparation, data cleaning and data analysis
Perform data consolidation in a strong control and analyses framework
Develop dynamic and intelligent dashboards
Work closely with our data providers and with our clients
Specific contributions to regulatory and internal stress testing exercises

Profile and Skills to Success


Master Degree in Information Technology / Computer Science or related
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in
Data Analysis / Engineering / Visualization
SQL
Python
Risk Management
Attention to detail / rigor
Ability to deliver / results driven
Active listening
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Analytical ability
Communication skills, both written and oral

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst - Mid
HTML:
Mid Data Analyst

At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.

YOUR ROLE

  • Collect, organize, analyze, and interpret large datasets for decision-making;
  • Clean and preprocess raw data to ensure data quality and integrity;
  • Conducting rigorous exploratory data analysis to discern trends and patterns, facilitating valuable insights;
  • Create clear and insightful data visualizations;
  • Engaging in collaborative efforts with team members to comprehend project requirements and actively contributing to solution development.
  • Contribute to team projects and implement data-driven strategies for business growth;
  • Communicating findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Manage and prioritize tasks effectively within project timelines.

YOUR PROFILE

  • Portuguese (Native) and English (Advanced);
  • Solid academic foundation in a relevant discipline, such as Mathematics, Data, or Computer Sciences.
  • Possesses a analytical mindset and meticulous attention to detail;
  • Skilled in problem-solving and critical thinking;
  • Collaborative team player with excellent communication skills;
  • Understand business requirements, develop analytical solutions, and communicate findings effectively.
  • Display a proactive approach to learning and applying emerging technologies and methodologies in data analytics.

Must have skills;

  • Proficiency in programming languages, particularly - Python (Pandas), SQL, and distributed/big data processing frameworks such as Pyspark.
  • Knowledge in data visualization and reporting tools; QilkSense, Matplotlib, Seaborn;
  • Familiarity with notebooks (such as Jupyter) and collaboration platforms; GitHub, GitLab;

Nice To Have Skills

  • Demonstrate familiarity with machine learning concepts and statistical analysis;
  • Experience with AWS Sagemaker/EMR;
  • Knowledge on the Telecom Industry.

What You'll Love About Working Here

  • Join a multicultural and inclusive team environment.
  • Enjoy a supportive atmosphere promoting work-life balance.
  • Engage in exciting national and international projects.
  • Hybrid work.
  • Your career growth is central to our mission. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professionals are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
  • Training and certifications programs.
  • Health and life insurance.
  • Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations.
  • Great office locations.

About Capgemini

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

Apply now!

Title: Data Driven | Data Scientist/Data analyst
Description:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of €1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let’s fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

We are creating a new role of Data scientist /Data analyst as Artificial intelligence (AI) and data science are a lever for improving the group's processes. The major challenge for the Data scientist/ Analyst daily is to ensure business development, the improvement of the customer experience and operational efficiency including controls. To do this, it must support the transformation in terms of processes or pathways by industrializing models.  

Extracts and analyses data to provide information that allows the company to better manage its activities and anticipate its future needs.
Monitor and coordinate the implementation of recommendations and local initiatives.
Build relevant data-driven insights and analyses to prepare and support business and operation decisions.
Communicate and present the conclusions of your analysis to other departments of the company through different forms (reports, dashboards, presentations).
Define relevant KPls to monitor performance and build dashboards.
Keep up to date with internal projects on artificial intelligence and analytics, to promote their work to PCMO on both the business and technological aspects.                                                              
Identify use cases that bring value to the regions' operational platforms.
Manage an AI project from start to the end. From identification of the needs to industrialization. This means framing the project, setting objectives and deliverables, monitoring IT & AI developments and governance, and ensuring that milestones are met.
Make the link between all the stakeholders in the ecosystem of a project (IT, Business, Data Scientists, etc.


Qualifications


IT language of his entity or project (Python and Other languages).
ETL (Alteryx, Dataiku).                                               
Data visualization: Power BI.                                               
MS Office Pack.     
English: Fluent.


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
We offer comprehensive market support and actively develop various high-tech blockchain products. Having successfully collaborated with over 1,500 clients, Gotbit has honed its expertise in designing user-friendly and effective blockchain solutions for businesses and end-users alike.

Who We Are

Gotbit has been in the market since 2017 and has established itself as a Tier-1 International Crypto Company. We offer comprehensive market support and actively develop various high-tech blockchain products. Having successfully collaborated with over 1,500 clients, Gotbit has honed its expertise in designing user-friendly and effective blockchain solutions for businesses and end-users alike.

Our team of over 200 skilled professionals spans the globe, bringing diverse perspectives and expertise to our projects.

Currently, our Consulting Department is looking for a Lead Data Analyst.

Responsibilities


Design, implement, and maintain data warehouses; ensure data integrity and consistency
Develop and manage ETL processes for accurate and efficient data integration; ensure smooth data flow for analytics
Analyze data for product performance and customer behavior; conduct A/B tests, develop strategies to improve key metrics and marketing ROI
Create and maintain interactive dashboards using tools like Tableau or Power BI; ensure they provide real-time insights
Lead a team of data analytics experts; collaborate with IT, marketing, and product teams; present findings and recommendations to stakeholders clearly and concisely


Requirements


Over 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst
Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, or other relevant programming languages
Experience with data warehousing solutions
Expertise in data visualization tools
Experience in product analytics tools
Understanding of ETL processes and tools
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex datasets
Fluent English (C1-C2)


Gotbit Offers


Remote work from any location
20 paid vacation days and 5 sick days annually
Full compensation for documented sick leave
Wellness support: We value our employees' well-being and cover expenses for sports, healthcare, coworking spaces, and team-building events
Continuous learning: Monthly Gotbit Educational Meetups featuring industry leaders help you stay ahead of the curve
Collaborative environment: Join our friendly and young team where all of your ideas will be heard


We look forward to receiving your application
Show more
HTML:
We offer comprehensive market support and actively develop various high-tech blockchain products. Having successfully collaborated with over 1,500 clients, Gotbit has honed its expertise in designing user-friendly and effective blockchain solutions for businesses and end-users alike.

Who We Are

Gotbit has been in the market since 2017 and has established itself as a Tier-1 International Crypto Company. We offer comprehensive market support and actively develop various high-tech blockchain products. Having successfully collaborated with over 1,500 clients, Gotbit has honed its expertise in designing user-friendly and effective blockchain solutions for businesses and end-users alike.

Our team of over 200 skilled professionals spans the globe, bringing diverse perspectives and expertise to our projects.

Currently, our Consulting Department is looking for a Lead Data Analyst.

Responsibilities

  • Design, implement, and maintain data warehouses; ensure data integrity and consistency
  • Develop and manage ETL processes for accurate and efficient data integration; ensure smooth data flow for analytics
  • Analyze data for product performance and customer behavior; conduct A/B tests, develop strategies to improve key metrics and marketing ROI
  • Create and maintain interactive dashboards using tools like Tableau or Power BI; ensure they provide real-time insights
  • Lead a team of data analytics experts; collaborate with IT, marketing, and product teams; present findings and recommendations to stakeholders clearly and concisely

Requirements

  • Over 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst
  • Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, or other relevant programming languages
  • Experience with data warehousing solutions
  • Expertise in data visualization tools
  • Experience in product analytics tools
  • Understanding of ETL processes and tools
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex datasets
  • Fluent English (C1-C2)

Gotbit Offers

  • Remote work from any location
  • 20 paid vacation days and 5 sick days annually
  • Full compensation for documented sick leave
  • Wellness support: We value our employees' well-being and cover expenses for sports, healthcare, coworking spaces, and team-building events
  • Continuous learning: Monthly Gotbit Educational Meetups featuring industry leaders help you stay ahead of the curve
  • Collaborative environment: Join our friendly and young team where all of your ideas will be heard

We look forward to receiving your application

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d) Ancillaries
Description:
We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d) for our Ancillaries Product Portfolio. Join our dynamic team in a fast-paced environment where every day brings new challenges and opportunities! In this critical role, you will work on a wide range of interesting tasks to actively support the business team in the revenue optimization process. The role is focused on driving our Ancillary Products to the next level by identifying new opportunities, managing the optimization of existing products as well as analyzing current performance and deriving actions. If you are passionate about working in a collaborative atmosphere and are ready to tackle intricate challenges head-on, we would love to hear from you! This position is available in Lisbon.

Your job - paint the world green


You create data analyses and models as a basis for decisions on the further development and optimization of our product offering.
You support in the development of the dynamic Ancillary Pricing concept and develop business rules as well as alert systems for price control.
You enjoy your creative freedom in developing solution concepts for problems and proactively work with product experts, BI and the agile development teams to identify suitable data sources, collection methods and data connections and ensure high data quality.
You define A/B tests including set-up and analyze results and derive actions.
You actively drive automation processes forward.
You communicate and present analytical approaches and results in a way that is appropriate for the target group.
You interact regularly with different types of stakeholders from our and other departments.


Your profile - ready to hop on board


Degree in business administration, mathematics, statistics, social sciences, business informatics, economics or similar
You have at least 5 years professional experience as Business Analyst, Data Analyst or data scientist, and are ideally familiar with the analysis of digital products
You are an expert context-switcher who thrives in an environment working on numerous different types of projects and tasks each day
You are experienced with A/B Test definition, set-up and especially analysis, used to work with CVR data, MDE etc.
You are an expert in SQL, Snowflake and python are a plus
You are familiar with common methods and tools for cleaning and merging different data sources as well as data preparation and visualization
You have solid experience in Excel and Power Point
You have excellent analytical skills and make decisions based on data.
You have a deep-dive mentality and enjoy developing creative solutions to solve problem statements
You are strongly driven, self-organized and highly reliable
You enjoy working with internal and external stakeholders, managing multiple projects and workstreams .
You like working in an international team and contributing to team development.
You speak fluent English, any other language is a plus.


Our Perks – More than just a job


You have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are creating the easiest way to travel. We want your ideas and give you autonomy to make them reality.
Flix is flexible. Organize your own schedule with trust-based hours and up to 60 days of working from (m)anywhere. We are an office-first company, and we encourage all employees to come regularly to their local office.
Travelling is our passion. Discover the world with your free Flix rides and bring along your friends and family for half price.
Teamwork makes the dream work. Our FlixTeam has people from over 80 different nations. We work in a multicultural environment where we can challenge and support each other.
We're not only green in color. We’re building for the long term, and that means protecting our planet. We constantly test new green technologies and compensate for the CO2 after all our business travel since 2018.
Your well-being is important to us. To treat your mind and body we will give you a competitive paid time off package, mental health support including 1:1 consultations with a psychologist, and a neat discount on UrbanSportsClub memberships.


Want to rewrite the history of mobility with us? Then join our ride and apply now. We're excited to hear from you! We recognize that everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences. If you think you could have an impact even though you don't meet 100% of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply.

About Flix

We are a global mobility provider with headquarters in Europe and the United States. Since 2013, we have changed the way millions of people have traveled, offering new alternatives for convenient, affordable and eco-friendly travel. Thanks to a unique business model and innovative technology, we have quickly established one of the largest long-distance mobility networks in the world – and our journey has just begun.

Flix is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy and gender identity), national, social or ethnic origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, competence and merit.

Title: Data Quality Analyst - Lisbon (Internal Team)
Description:
At Efficio, we're not just a consulting firm; we're a team of dedicated experts committed to transforming procurement and supply chain functions. Our mission is to drive sustainable, measurable value for our clients through innovative solutions and deep industry insights. Join us and be part of a dynamic environment where your skills and ideas make a real impact.

Efficio is the world’s largest specialist procurement and supply chain consultancy, with offices across Europe, North America, and the Middle East. We’re a diverse team of over 1,000 individuals, representing more than 60 different nationalities and speaking 40+ languages – and we’re continuing to grow rapidly!

With Efficio, you will enjoy the benefits of working with an established management consultancy that still maintains its entrepreneurial spirit and close-knit community. We’ve almost doubled in size over the last few years, and we don’t plan on stopping anytime soon. We’re looking for the future leaders of Efficio who will continue to invest in what matters to us: supporting our clients’ success, celebrating creativity, and helping our team to follow their passions and ambitions. We’re proud of our company culture – collaborative, dynamic, down to earth, and fiercely international. Our teams devote the time to connect, learn, and socialise across project teams and offices globally.

We are looking for a meticulous Data Quality Analyst to ensure the high quality of our data.

The responsibilities of a Data Quality Analyst include establishing data quality rules, maintaining data standards, liaising with various departments to ensure data accuracy and quality, and conducting quality assurance tests.

Our ideal candidate has strong analytical skills, pays great attention to detail, and has a deep understanding of databases and data quality procedures.

If you’re able to work in Lisbon and ready to take on a challenging yet rewarding role in a dynamic, globally-minded team, we’d love to hear from you!

This role gives you the opportunity to:


Work across teams to gather data quality requirements.
Define a data strategy including the implementation of test automation and data observability
Work closely with data producers and data consumers to ensure data quality.
Where needed, perform manual tests to ensure data pipeline operation
Work with management to prioritise data quality activities and timelines
Identify and define new process improvement opportunities.
Monitor and analyse data and data quality, ensuring consistency, accuracy and compliance with internal standards and regulations.
Report on data quality issues and present data quality metrics.
Advocate for data quality throughout the department
Upskill Data Analysts and Engineers to understand Data Quality


We'd love to hear about any additional skills or experiences you bring to the table. We're particularly interested in:


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field
Proven work experience as a Data Quality Analyst
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc.), databases (SQL etc.), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.
Prior experience of evangelising Data Quality.
Show more

Title: Advanced Analytics Consultant
Description:
Na Deloitte, oferecemos uma experiência profissional que inspira talentos como tu a transformar o mundo como o conhecemos, a torná-lo mais humano, eficiente e tecnológico. Somos um Tech Hub internacional e estamos à procura dos melhores especialistas em tecnologia para se juntarem aos nossos centros de excelência e à nossa comunidade, para desenvolverem soluções únicas e inovadoras nos mais variados e complexos projetos de transformação, de Portugal para o mundo.

És tu quem procuramos?


Formação superior nas áreas de Engenharia Informática, Engenharia Eletrotécnica e de Computadores ou similar
Anos de experiência: 2 a 5 anos em consultoria e em Business Intelligence/ Analytics
Conhecimentos sólidos em data mining & Machine Learning
Conhecimentos técnicos em R, Python, SAS Machine Learning e IBM Watson ou ferramentas similares
Conhecimento da língua Inglesa no domínio falado e escrito
Autonomia, capacidade analítica e espírito crítico
Capacidade de comunicação e trabalho em equipa
Orientação para o cliente e para resultados
Comunicação, relacionamento interpessoal, trabalho em equipa e colaboração
Resolução de problemas, capacidade analítica e espírito crítico
Organização, planeamento e orientação para a qualidade dos projetos
Orientação para o cliente e para resultados



Desenvolve uma carreira à tua medida


Num contexto de trabalho diverso que permite um desenvolvimento e aprendizagem contínuos
Através de um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira personalizado (skills/ oportunidades técnicas e funcionais), adequado ao momento, às tuas necessidades e objetivos
Participando em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimensão e impacto relevante nesta área de especialização
Acesso ilimitado às maiores plataformas de aprendizagem online (Linkedin Learning e Udemy)
Oportunidade de formações e certificações nas mais recentes tecnologias, nomeadamente em tecnologias Cloud



Vive uma cultura de união


Uma cultura de inovação e excelência que nos torna líderes e percursores de tendências
Um ambiente amigável, de respeito, confiança, transparência e informalidade
Uma rede para a vida que te faz estar ligado ao melhor conhecimento ao lado de líderes e especialistas
Uma oportunidade para fazeres parte das nossas comunidades (de Tech, inovação, desporto e outros interesses) e para participares ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social.



Sobre a Deloitte

Na Deloitte, nunca trabalharás sozinho. Vais integrar os mais variados e desafiantes projetos e fazer parte do nosso Global Solutions Center, onde poderás colaborar de forma integrada com outras equipas da rede global Deloitte. Terás sempre alguém ao teu lado para te inspirar, ajudar e desafiar a expandir os teus horizontes, enquanto exploras soluções tecnológicas diferenciadoras. Aqui, ao encontrares um ambiente dinâmico, colaborativo e humano, terás a oportunidade de desenvolver a tua melhor versão.

Além disso, as nossas equipas em Portugal têm projeção internacional, o que demonstra a nossa forte liderança global em diversas expertises tecnológicas.

Se tens interesse em explorar e desenvolver as tuas competências e fazer parte de equipas que desenvolvem soluções nas tecnologias líderes de mercado, então estás no lugar certo!

Somos mais de 5.500 pessoas em Portugal, das quais mais de 2.600 trabalham em áreas tecnológicas, a partir de escritórios e Digital Studios em Lisboa, Porto, Viseu, Coimbra e Faro e de polos tecnológicos em Braga, Setúbal e Leiria.

Keywords: Sobre a Deloitte; Technology; Consulting; Anos de Experiência


Show more

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Consultant - Join our Talent Community!
Description:
Company Description

We are looking for Senior Business Intelligence Consultants to join our Talent Community.

Please apply to this ad if you would like to be considered for our Business Intelligence Talent Community, and to be kept in the loop on future job openings in our team.

You will be helping our clients to get new insights from data, analyse and visualise their business to enable smarter decisions and better products & services delivery. Your primary focus will be in understanding business goals/KPIs, data ingestion, analysis and visualisation in cloud-based reporting tools.

Are you ready to grow your expertise? Education and development are not just empty words for us, and we will guide you through your learning journey.

We are part of Merkle, leading global agency in digital transformation, focused on improving customer experience and creating world-class solutions to our clients. Your team is a diverse group of people from more than 15 nationalities and different backgrounds. We have a supportive atmosphere, and our work is based on the principles of equality and inclusion.

We have a hybrid workplace with offices in Lisbon, Vila Real, Guarda and Leiria. Our BI Consultants report to BI Team Lead.

Job Description

What do our Senior BI Consultants do?


Participation in workshops with client's stakeholders to validate goals, expected inputs & deliverables
Doing requirements gathering, logical models, functional & technical designs
Performing data analysis of business requirements, understanding source data and map them to the target/common data model
Defining and implementing reports to visualize insights/KPIs on dashboards, using BI tools like PowerBI or Tableau
Working with data engineers to productionize data pipelines and automate reports generation & distribution


Qualifications

What person and previous experience are we looking for?


Previous experience in a similar BI functional role (5+ years) preferably in telco, financial or digital marketing services industry
Past experience in using BI tools like PowerBI, Tableau, Qlick Sense, Keboola
Solid proficiency in data warehousing concepts (ETL, Stage/Core layer, Dimensional Modelling, Data Marts etc.) and SQL programming
Experience with SQL databases, such as Oracle or MS SQL Server
Strong analytical and communication skills, data-oriented personality


Preferred Skills


Hands-on experience in MS Azure, AWS or other cloud-based environments is a big plus
Business expertise in areas of Digital Marketing (AdTech), Marketing Automation, CRM or e-commerce is a significant advantage
Understanding data workflow management and ETL tools like Informatica, Pentaho, Azure Data Factory, Airflow, NiFi, StreamSets, Glue, etc.
Understanding of big data processing using technologies like Hadoop, Spark, etc.
Proficiency in scripting languages like Python/JavaScript


Additional Information

Why you should work with us?!


We are cooperating with an all types and sizes of clients from all around the world which allows us to provide a very diverse portfolio of projects and technologies to choose from to our people.
You will be part of a startup-minded branch of a company with a very strong and stable background of the Swiss/German headquarters.
Your contributions will have a distinct impact on our clients


We offer even more


Cutting Edge Technology & Latest IT tools;
Software-house environment;
Agile and Flexible working hours;
Hybrid work system (remote friendly);
Digital nomad policy;
Focus on career development;
Health insurance (also included for the household);
Mental health support;
Volunteering experiences and sustainable mindset;
25 vacation days + 3 wellness days per year;
Beers (after 6pm), football, and ping-pong! #workhardplayhard
Free breakfast every second Monday of the month;
Employee discounts;
Team & Company events 🎉


Merkle do not discriminate against job applicants on the basis of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Experience stipulated in this job description serves as a guide only and all applications will be considered on their merits, irrespective of experience.

About Merkle

Merkle, a dentsu company, powers the experience economy. For more than 35 years, the company has put people at the heart of its approach to digital business transformation. As the only integrated experience consultancy in the world with a heritage in data science and business performance, Merkle delivers holistic, end-to-end experiences that drive growth, engagement, and loyalty. Merkle's expertise has earned recognition as a "Leader" by top industry analyst firms, in categories such as digital transformation and commerce, experience design, engineering and technology integration, digital marketing, data science, CRM and loyalty, and customer data management. With more than 16,000 employees, Merkle operates in 30+ countries throughout the Americas, EMEA, and APAC. For more information, visit www.merkle.com.
Show more

  • Participation in workshops with client's stakeholders to validate goals, expected inputs & deliverables
  • Doing requirements gathering, logical models, functional & technical designs
  • Performing data analysis of business requirements, understanding source data and map them to the target/common data model
  • Defining and implementing reports to visualize insights/KPIs on dashboards, using BI tools like PowerBI or Tableau
  • Working with data engineers to productionize data pipelines and automate reports generation & distribution

Qualifications

What person and previous experience are we looking for?

  • Previous experience in a similar BI functional role (5+ years) preferably in telco, financial or digital marketing services industry
  • Past experience in using BI tools like PowerBI, Tableau, Qlick Sense, Keboola
  • Solid proficiency in data warehousing concepts (ETL, Stage/Core layer, Dimensional Modelling, Data Marts etc.) and SQL programming
  • Experience with SQL databases, such as Oracle or MS SQL Server
  • Strong analytical and communication skills, data-oriented personality

Preferred Skills

  • Hands-on experience in MS Azure, AWS or other cloud-based environments is a big plus
  • Business expertise in areas of Digital Marketing (AdTech), Marketing Automation, CRM or e-commerce is a significant advantage
  • Understanding data workflow management and ETL tools like Informatica, Pentaho, Azure Data Factory, Airflow, NiFi, StreamSets, Glue, etc.
  • Understanding of big data processing using technologies like Hadoop, Spark, etc.
  • Proficiency in scripting languages like Python/JavaScript

Additional Information

Why you should work with us?!

  • We are cooperating with an all types and sizes of clients from all around the world which allows us to provide a very diverse portfolio of projects and technologies to choose from to our people.
  • You will be part of a startup-minded branch of a company with a very strong and stable background of the Swiss/German headquarters.
  • Your contributions will have a distinct impact on our clients

We offer even more

  • Cutting Edge Technology & Latest IT tools;
  • Software-house environment;
  • Agile and Flexible working hours;
  • Hybrid work system (remote friendly);
  • Digital nomad policy;
  • Focus on career development;
  • Health insurance (also included for the household);
  • Mental health support;
  • Volunteering experiences and sustainable mindset;
  • 25 vacation days + 3 wellness days per year;
  • Beers (after 6pm), football, and ping-pong! #workhardplayhard
  • Free breakfast every second Monday of the month;
  • Employee discounts;
  • Team & Company events 🎉

Merkle do not discriminate against job applicants on the basis of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Experience stipulated in this job description serves as a guide only and all applications will be considered on their merits, irrespective of experience.

About Merkle

Merkle, a dentsu company, powers the experience economy. For more than 35 years, the company has put people at the heart of its approach to digital business transformation. As the only integrated experience consultancy in the world with a heritage in data science and business performance, Merkle delivers holistic, end-to-end experiences that drive growth, engagement, and loyalty. Merkle's expertise has earned recognition as a "Leader" by top industry analyst firms, in categories such as digital transformation and commerce, experience design, engineering and technology integration, digital marketing, data science, CRM and loyalty, and customer data management. With more than 16,000 employees, Merkle operates in 30+ countries throughout the Americas, EMEA, and APAC. For more information, visit www.merkle.com.

Title: Loyalty Data Analyst (hybrid)
HTML:
Muito Gosto! Somos o Grupo DATA!

O nosso propósito é simplificar a vida dos nossos clientes e fazemos isso em todo o mundo, através das nossas soluções de TI.

Somos uma multinacional que opera activamente em Portugal, e estamos em constante expansão!

Adoramos trabalhar com grandes empresas, mas também em fazer as empresas com as quais colaboramos crescerem. Comprometemo-nos a ser a mudança que queremos ver nas grandes corporações do mercado, ao começar por valorizar as pessoas e as suas ideias.

Percebemos que não existe apenas uma maneira de fazer as coisas funcionar, que cada um dos nossos colaboradores tem características únicas e que, para trabalhar em equipa, precisamos realmente de nos conhecer.

O que procuramos?

  • Licenciatura em Marketing;
  • Experiência 3 anos em áreas de CRM ou Loyalty;
  • Competências sólidas de análise e interpretação de dados, sendo valorizado experiência anterior com PowerBI, looker ou plataformas de gestão de rewards;
  • Orientação para a eficiência operacional e automatização de processos;
  • Capacidade de gestão de projetos, organização e planeamento;
  • Capacidade de trabalho em equipa;
  • Bons conhecimentos de inglês será um plus.

Responsabilidades

  • Operacionalização de campanhas na plataforma de loyalty;
  • Construir relatórios de monitorização dos resultados das acções;
  • Trabalhar numa óptica de melhoria continua de forma a automatizar os processos;
  • Contribuir para a identificação da necessidade de novas ferramentas, e acompanhar projectos de desenvolvimento;
  • Análise de incidentes mais graves, bem como definição do plano de resolução e de criação de procedimentos.

Regime em modalidade híbrida, em Lisboa, 3 vezes por semana no escritório.

çõ !

Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description:
About Capgemini Engineering

Hi there

We are Capgemini Engineering. A brand part of the Capgemini Group.

We have the mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, diversity, inclusion, a purpose of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world.

You can help us to achieve our mission!

Now, we have more than 270,000 team members in nearly 50 countries, in sectors such as aeronautics, automotive, communications, energy, life sciences, software & internet, space & defense and consumer products.

Your Mission

You will be part of a central data enterprise team within the data technology pillar that aims at building the best data technology solutions for the client. You will work with other engineers and product teams to create the best-in-class data platform with leading capabilities to support the business solve the most critical challenges through data solutions.

Your Role


Design, develop, and maintain scalable and efficient data-centric applications and systems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement new features and enhancements in cloud environments like AWS, GCP, or Azure.
Design, build, and optimize data pipelines ensuring reliability, scalability, and compliance with industry standards.
Conduct thorough data analysis, modeling, and interpretation to drive insights and support decision-making processes.
Create and maintain ELT/ETL processes, focusing on data quality, reliability, and efficiency.
Evaluate, recommend, and implement improvements in data infrastructure and methodologies to reduce costs and enhance performance.
Support ongoing AI & Analytics operations and systems, interpret trends
Communicate findings, proposals, and technical solutions effectively to diverse stakeholders.
Team work in a data-driven, solution oriented and critical mind-set is greatly encouraged and valued.
Profiency in English is greatly valued


Your Profile


At least 2 years of experience in data engineering roles with expertise in building and maintaining data pipelines, systems, and applications.
Proficient in data warehouse design, implementation, and optimization, leveraging ETL/ELT processes, schema modeling, and ensuring efficient data retrieval for analytical purposes.
Proficient in at least programming/querying languages used for data engineering such as Python and SQL, NoSQLs, or similar languages.
Knowledge and Hands-on experience either with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure), or in Linux OS
Strong understanding of data modeling, both SQL and NoSQL, with expertise in distributed systems design.
Experience with big data technologies such as Spark or other distributed processing technologies
Familiarity with tools for workflow orchestration such as Airflow
Knowledge of data governance, metadata management, and best practices in ensuring data quality and compliance.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively in cross-functional teams.
Analytical mindset, attention to detail, and problem-solving skills to address complex data challenges.
Familiarity with Standard AI/ML processes & operations is greatly valued.
Degree in computer science, software engineering, or other engineering domains.
Proficiency in English is mandatory. Additional languages are an advantage.

Title: Data Loss Prevention Analyst
Description:
About The Job


BNP PARIBAS, the leading bank in the European Union and a leading international player, is seeking to complement and strengthen its existing teams in the areas of IT risk management, cybersecurity and the fight against digital fraud
Within IT Group, Informatics Directorate of BNP Paribas, the Cybersecurity & Digital Fraud Department's mission aims to structure, strengthen and harmonize IT risk management and cybersecurity for the overall BNP Paribas Group (approximately 30 entities) and:
define the vision and strategy for IT risk management and cybersecurity, and ensuring the implementation of this strategy within the Group’s operating entities
monitor the security of the Group's information systems
steer the IT Continuity and Resilience strategy and methodological framework
Regarding the need to increase its Information Assets protection and the deployment of its Cybersecurity Program, BNP Paribas is restructuring its teams in charge of Data Leakage Prevention/monitoring

Your Main Activities Are


Assess the events generated by the DLP tool, according to predefined criteria (alert treatment Level 1) on the different scopes
Review & analyze the daily events, and potentially route them to Level 2 for a deeper analysis
Investigate at Level 2 to allow confirmation & assessment of data leaks
Contribute to employee awareness in case of bad practices
Review & Analyze security problems in order to identify the weak points in the DLP monitoring system
Liaise with the control manager regarding DLP events detection, or specific rules review (e.g. a great number of anomalies generated in a short period)
Suggest good practices based on the DLP events typology, in order to optimize detection capability
Manage access rights to the DLP consoles
Manage DLP exceptions implementation
Contribute to the testing and analysis of new DLP policies
Coordinate the review of policies and validated practices
Perform a weekly follow-up of the entities, regarding their backlog and the compliance with the processes
Provide functional and tool support to our clients
Produce the Monthly DLP Dashboard
Manage the deployment of new entities / scopes on our platform


Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology
Relevant background in Data Loss Prevention
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Attention to detail / rigor
Analytical ability
Creativity and innovation / problem solving


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About The Job


BNPP Global Markets Americas is looking to expand its team of dedicated data engineers in Portugal to support Prime Services, part of the Global Equities Global Business Line (GBL).
The team in Portugal works closely with Prime Services Prime Trading Americas. This team is focused on generating business analytics, building data pipelines, and projects implementation to better position the business for their current and future needs. A primary focus of the role is assisting in the improvement of funding efficiencies and meeting client demand through improved data availability and analysis, client insights, and ultimately through enhanced data and business processes. The ability to work with large amount of messy data and designing and then implementing improved data models will be important. A successful candidate should have strong communication skills, be a team player, have the ability to learn quickly, and focus on delivery in a fast-paced environment. The job will require interaction with Front Office, Technology, and Product Development.


Your Main Activities Are


The required position would support Equity Financing business in its reporting : creation / automation / monitoring (both the indicators produced and the fact that report is being produced)
Within the Support team, the individual will work closely with Front Office and Quant Research :
Monitor production of daily reports required by the business :
Trouble shot with IT in case of production issue
Data quality check day over day. Escalation to Operations (MO) and Front in case of booking issue
Improve automation of reports production
Work with Business and Quant to enhance existing reports with new data / method
Automate production from XL based template to server based production
Design new reports, and provide analysis and optimization suggestion
Work with business to enhance our reporting framework to display more relevant indicators
Once familiar with data, help in the analysis of the reports , highlight outsiders and suggest improvements
Ability to travel to New York for a period of up to 1 month for on-desk experience and training

Profile and Skills to Success


BA, BS or MS degree in a quantitative discipline (Math, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Finance or Economics)
1-4 years of relevant experience such as in Data Analytics or Engineering
Experience in Capital Markets or Investment Banking
Perfect fluency in English
Good communication skills
Proficiency in Python, SQL Excel and VBA
Quantitative, analytical and logical problem solving skill
Basic knowledge of financial markets and Prime Brokerage
Experience using Dev-ops tools such as GIT, Jira and APIs


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Seeking a Data Engineer: Rhino, are you there?

At WE ARE META, we focus on finding the perfect match between our Rhinos and our clients.

Why join us?


Expand your network: As a consultant at We Are META, you’ll have access to a network of national and international partners across diverse sectors of the tech industry.
Enjoy our perks: When you join the crash you’ll have an array of benefits, to help you achieve the best work-life balance.
Get your perfect match: Our recruiters do their best to get the best position for you, whether in terms of working policy (remote, hybrid, on-site) or the company’s culture.
Personalized support: With our career coach, we assure that all your needs are being met and you’re being provided everything you need to excel in your professional life because the well-being of our Rhinos is our number one priority.


Perks Of Becoming a Rhino


You’ll get a welcome kit 📚
Opportunities for career progression 📈
Live on the edge with our health insurance 🏥
Watch your favorite shows and music with HBO and Spotify accounts 📺 🎵
Coverflex meal card 🍲 💳
Other protocols and special discounts ✨


For this position, the perfect Rhino should have the following skills:


+3 years of experience as a Data Engineer
Proficiency in GCP
Knowledge of BigQuery, CloudRun, GitHub
Availability to work in a hybrid model in Lisbon
Fluency in English (B2 Level) is mandatory


Become a part of the crash. In a world of unicorns, be a Rhino!
