Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
HTML:
A QiBit procura Data Analysts para integração num Tech Hub internacional e estamos à procura dos melhores especialistas em tecnologia para se juntarem aos centros de excelência e à comunidade internacional do nosso cliente, uma prestigiada Big4, para desenvolverem soluções únicas e inovadoras nos mais variados e complexos projetos de transformação.


  • Formato Híbrido: 3 dias em escritório, 2 em casa;
  • Contrato Permanente;
  • Pacote de benefícios competitivo.


O teu dia a dia e responsabilidades vão ser compostos por:


  • Analise de dados em várias tecnologias, SQL e No-SQL;
  • Desenho, implementação, e monitorização de pipelines ETL;
  • Criação de processos para tratamento de dados (data profiling, cleansing, masking);
  • Desenho e implementação de soluções real-time analytics;
  • Desenho e implementação de soluções Big Data;
  • Desenho e Implementação de soluções data-driven distribuídas com recurso a tecnologias Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP);
  • Colaborar com vários stakeholders na definição, tratamento de dados e implementação de modelos avançados de Machine Learning.
  • Garantir a coordenação entre equipas técnicas e funcionais no âmbito de projetos de dados;


És tu quem procuramos:


  • Formação superior nas áreas de Engenharia ou similares;
  • Conhecimento da língua Inglesa (oral e escrita) e disponibilidade para viajar;
  • Entre 2 a 6 Anos de experiência profissional em projetos de Data;
  • Conhecimento de processos de desenvolvimento de software;
  • Experiência com metodologias Agile;
  • Conhecimentos de linguagens SQL / No SQL;
  • Conhecimentos em Python;
  • Experiência profissional em soluções ETL (exemplos, Azure Data Fabric, AWS Glue, Snowflake, SSIS, IBM DataStage) (preferencial);
  • Experiência em soluções da Data Visualization (exemplos, Power BI, Tableau);
  • Experiência profissional com Data Warehouses / Data Lakes;
  • Conhecimento das soluções Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP) orientadas a arquiteturas de dados distribuídos;
  • Experiência profissional em soluções/tecnologias Big Data (exemplos, Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, ELK, MongoDB) (preferencial);
  • Orientação para o cliente e para resultados;
  • Comunicação, trabalho em equipa, resolução de problemas e capacidade analítica.


Desenvolve uma carreira à tua medida


  • Num contexto de trabalho diverso que permite um desenvolvimento e aprendizagem contínuos
  • Através de um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira personalizado (skills/ oportunidades técnicas e funcionais), adequado ao momento, às tuas necessidades e objetivos
  • Participando em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimensão e impacto relevante nesta área de especialização
  • Acesso ilimitado às maiores plataformas de aprendizagem online (Linkedin Learning e Udemy).
  • Oportunidade de formações e certificações nas mais recentes tecnologias, nomeadamente em tecnologias Cloud.


Se este é o teu perifl, submete a tua candidatura.

Title: Data analyst and Continuous Improvement - Trainee
Description:
Who We Are

As a global leader in generic medicines with a strong innovative portfolio, we are all in for better health.

Teva Pharmaceuticals has been developing and producing medicines for more than 120 years. Along with our established presence in generics, we have significant research and operations supporting our growing portfolio of innovative medicines and biopharmaceutical products.

Today, our portfolio of around 3,600 products is among the largest of any pharmaceutical company in the world. Nearly 200 million people in 60 countries benefit from one of Teva's quality medicines every day. We invest in research and development of innovative medicines, generic drugs and biosimilars, carrying on the legacy of more than a century of finding new ways to help patients improve their lives. This defines our values as a company and characterizes how we do business and approach medicine.

The opportunity

We are looking for a motivated candidate for the role of Data analyst and Continuous Improvement trainee

As a Data analyst and Continuous Improvement Trainee, you will support organizational transformation projects within Teva Portugal. Your responsibilities will include to propose, track and support change initiatives, including the review, documentation and optimization of internal processes. Additionally, you will cooperate in data analysis projects and initiatives to support needs of the business and to build on existing KPIs.

This position is suited for a junior professional / newly graduate with some knowledge of or interest in the Pharmaceutical Industry, along with good data analysis skills and a passion for process design and for driving organizational improvement every day.

Work languages: Portuguese & English.

How You’ll Spend Your Day


Drive and collaborate with multiple projects pertaining to data management and analytics (i.e. KPI setup and tracking, database management, etc);
Support the assessment of current business processes;
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas for improvement, using data analytics & KPIs;
Track the execution of improvement initiatives in line with the broader vision for change and organizational goals;
When applicable, lead and implement improvement initiatives across the organization;
Monitor the effectiveness of the initiatives after implementation;


Your Experience And Qualifications


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business/Economics/Management, Supply Chain, Pharmaceutical Sciences, Data Science/Analytics, Engineering, etc).
Proficiency in data analysis tools
Proficiency in English
Previous exposure to the Pharmaceutical Industry in Portugal and understanding of key business processes is a plus


Desired Traits


Curiosity and eagerness to learn and explore innovative solutions.
Analytical and evidence-based mindset, with a focus on data-driven organizational improvement.
Ability to communicate and work collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment with limited oversight.


Reports To

Assoc Dir Supply Chain

Already Working @TEVA?

If you are a current Teva employee, please apply using the internal career site available on "Employee Central". By doing so, your application will be treated with priority. You will also be able to see opportunities that are open exclusively to Teva employees. Use the following link to search and apply: Internal Career Site

The internal career site is available from your home network as well. If you have trouble accessing your EC account, please contact your local HR/IT partner.

Teva’s Equal Employment Opportunity Commitment

Teva Pharmaceuticals is committed to equal opportunity in employment. It is Teva's global policy that equal employment opportunity be provided without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, ancestry, veteran status, national or ethnic origin or any other legally recognized status entitled to protection under applicable laws. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to support you throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

Please send us your application until the 30th of September.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Mission

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Inetum Team and be part of a work culture focused on innovation!

Location: Lisbon

Main Responsibilities

  • Lead dashboard projects from End to End in cyber security risk management;
  • Collect, analyze, and interpret data sets to create visual representations that support decision making;
  • Work with the other departments within Cyber to identify business needs, design effective data models, develop and maintain dashboards;
  • ...

Profile

  • Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or similar;
  • +3 years of experience in data analytics and dashboard development;
  • Professional experience with Tableau, Power BI and Dataiku;
  • Strong experience with PostgreSQL and ETL tools;
  • Experience with Azure Cloud;
  • Excellent communication skills;
  • Team work driven;
  • Fluent English;
  • French B1/B2;
  • Hybrid work - office in Lisbon (1/2x per week).

Send your CV & join our team!

Perfil

Organização

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum’s team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum’s solutions aim at contributing to its clients’ performance and innovation as well as the common good. Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility. Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Title: STDA Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Stress Testing Data Analytics (STDA) team has a key role to play in the development of a strong risk management framework for the BNP Paribas Group. The team is responsible for the elaboration of the dataset that will be used as the starting point for modelling activities and stress testing exercises, which are crucial in granting the Group means to anticipate risks
The team works on a Big Data environment, with access to an ecosystem of Hadoop tools including Spark and Hive. Dataiku DSS (Data Science Studio) is used as an end-user interface, providing a visual approach to the implementation of ETL (Extract Transform Load) pipelines. Data visualization is also a part of the team's responsibilities, with Tableau as the main tool
The team works in partnership with the IT department of the Group regarding the stress-testing platform. They support the team on a daily-basis and help with back-end big data engineering support and maintenance
In this role, you will join the team dedicated to credit risk. Your primary responsibility will be to handle big data, perform in-depth data analysis, present data to see beyond the numbers and prepare the databases used for the projection of credit risk parameters for stress testing and IFRS 9

Your Main Activities Are


Execute data collection, data ingestion, data quality, data preparation, data cleaning and data analysis
Perform data consolidation in a strong control and analyses framework
Develop dynamic and intelligent dashboards
Work closely with our data providers and with our clients
Specific contributions to regulatory and internal stress testing exercises

Profile and Skills to Success


Master Degree in Information Technology / Computer Science or related
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in
Data Analysis / Engineering / Visualization
SQL
Python
Risk Management
Attention to detail / rigor
Ability to deliver / results driven
Active listening
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Analytical ability
Communication skills, both written and oral

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: BI Analyst (m/f) – Hibrido (Lisboa)
Description:
Descrição da Empresa

Somos uma Consultora com competências multidisciplinares dotada de um portfólio que abrange diversas áreas, como Financeira, Telecomunicações, Automóvel. Desenvolvemos Produtos e Projectos. Estamos presentes em empresas de referência Nacionais e Internacionais. A nossa combinação única de soluções tecnológicas, metodologias e os nossos recursos humanos qualificam a entrega aos nossos clientes.

Descrição da Função

A Match Profiler é uma consultora de Sistemas de Informação que atua desde 1999 no mercado nacional e internacional. Temos competências multidisciplinares e know-how na área de IT que nos permite contribuir, otimizar e progredir com os nossos clientes. Para integrar equipa do nosso cliente estamos de momento a recrutar profissionais com o seguinte perfil: BI Analyst (m/f) – Hibrido (Lisboa) O que precisas de ter: Hard skills


Até 5 anos de experiência no role para o qual estamos a contratualizar o serviço;
Experiência em ferramentas de Dashboards, linguagem SQL, ferramentas Office e em particular Excel nível avançado
Experiência e/ou conhecimento em modelação de dados, ferramenta SAS Enterprise Guide, ferramenta DOMO
Fluência em Inglês Soft skills
Boa comunicação
Espírito de equipa
Proactividade
Gestão de tempo O que nós podemos proporcionar:
Acompanhamento personalizado por parte da tua equipa
O teu manager vai estar atento às tuas motivações e sugestões
As vitórias e conquistas serão festejadas em conjunto

Lisboa, Portugal

Title: RISK Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


Themission of RISK is to provide Senior Management of the Group and of theOperating Divisions, with full transparency and dynamic analysis of the riskand clients managed by Corporate and Investment Banking (CIB) and InvestmentSolutions (IS) business units
RISKcontributes to the definition of the Group’s risk appetite, its riskdecision-making process and the optimization of capital allocation to supportthe development of the Operating Divisions
RISKSystems team is part of RISK. Its mission consists in providing the Bank with acomprehensive capital markets risk system used to calculate market andcounterparty risk capital figures using advanced methods and to support theneeds of users for risk analysis, risk reporting and the credit process
Inthis context, Operations team is a global team responsible for the productionof market and counterparty risk metrics to the RISK function. The team is splitbetween London, Paris, Hong Kong, New York, Singapore, Mumbai, Brussels,Montreal, Sao Paulo, Lisbon and Porto
Operationsteam is in charge of functional support on market and counterparty risk systemsof the bank. The team in Portugal is focusing in particular on the qualityaspects of the data that feeds those systems: ensuring data quality issues areresolved, putting in place meaningful Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) aboutdata quality, reviewing and improving existing processes and KPIs, andassisting on the preparation of material for committees where those KPIs arediscussed
Themission of Operations team is met by:
Ensuringclients and Senior management have a clear vision of the quality of theservices provided by Operation teams, thanks to the production of meaningfulKPIs about our main services.
Resolutionof incidents related to data quality.
Regularcalibration of market variables used for the calculation of risk metrics.
Streamlining,running, documenting existing processes that currently lack industrialisation

Your Main Activities Are


Workon Data quality aspects, putting in place Key Performance Indicators about thequality of the data in our systems (statistics on timeliness and quality ofdaily risk indicators) and maintaining these KPIs
Investigateissues detected by those KPIs and help to resolve them permanently.
Tohelp on the regular analysis and update of the parameters used in riskmanagement systems (such as interest rates or FX rates). Help to explainValue-at-Risk movements based on recent updates of such market variables
Providetraining and guidance to new users of the system where required
Buildclose links with risk analysts and other internal RISK Systems clients

Profile and Skills to Success


BachelorDegree in Business / Finance / Mathematics / IT or related
Advancedlevel of English, both written and oral
Knowledgein
MSOffice Pack
PowerBI
Good marketand/or Counterparty Risk knowledge
Attentionto detail / rigor
Abilityto deliver / results driven
Organisationalskills

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

    • RISKcontributes to the definition of the Group’s risk appetite, its riskdecision-making process and the optimization of capital allocation to supportthe development of the Operating Divisions
    • RISKSystems team is part of RISK. Its mission consists in providing the Bank with acomprehensive capital markets risk system used to calculate market andcounterparty risk capital figures using advanced methods and to support theneeds of users for risk analysis, risk reporting and the credit process
    • Inthis context, Operations team is a global team responsible for the productionof market and counterparty risk metrics to the RISK function. The team is splitbetween London, Paris, Hong Kong, New York, Singapore, Mumbai, Brussels,Montreal, Sao Paulo, Lisbon and Porto
    • Operationsteam is in charge of functional support on market and counterparty risk systemsof the bank. The team in Portugal is focusing in particular on the qualityaspects of the data that feeds those systems: ensuring data quality issues areresolved, putting in place meaningful Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) aboutdata quality, reviewing and improving existing processes and KPIs, andassisting on the preparation of material for committees where those KPIs arediscussed
    • Themission of Operations team is met by:
      • Ensuringclients and Senior management have a clear vision of the quality of theservices provided by Operation teams, thanks to the production of meaningfulKPIs about our main services.
      • Resolutionof incidents related to data quality.
      • Regularcalibration of market variables used for the calculation of risk metrics.
      • Streamlining,running, documenting existing processes that currently lack industrialisation
Your Main Activities Are

    • Workon Data quality aspects, putting in place Key Performance Indicators about thequality of the data in our systems (statistics on timeliness and quality ofdaily risk indicators) and maintaining these KPIs
    • Investigateissues detected by those KPIs and help to resolve them permanently.
    • Tohelp on the regular analysis and update of the parameters used in riskmanagement systems (such as interest rates or FX rates). Help to explainValue-at-Risk movements based on recent updates of such market variables
    • Providetraining and guidance to new users of the system where required
    • Buildclose links with risk analysts and other internal RISK Systems clients
Profile and Skills to Success

    • BachelorDegree in Business / Finance / Mathematics / IT or related
    • Advancedlevel of English, both written and oral
    • Knowledgein
      • MSOffice Pack
      • PowerBI
      • Good marketand/or Counterparty Risk knowledge
    • Attentionto detail / rigor
    • Abilityto deliver / results driven
    • Organisationalskills
Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Quality Analyst (12 months)
Description:
Job Type

Permanent

Build a brilliant future with Hiscox

About Us

HISCOX is an international insurer specialized in the market of luxury goods & property, and high end professional insurance. As experts in risk we give people and businesses the confidence to realise their ambitions. With offices in 9 European countries we have a very international staff and encourage a culture that fosters inclusion and collaboration, offering exciting opportunities for personal and professional growth.

In our Lisbon office we have the privilege of employing approximately 500 exceptional professionals representing 29 diverse nationalities. Despite our central location within the city, we recognize the importance of maintaining a healthy work-life balance. As part of our commitment to our employees’ well-being, we provide a 35-hour workweek along with the option for a hybrid working schedule.

The Role

The Data Quality Analyst is a role in the Europe Data Team who is responsible to support the delivery of new Data Management practices within Hiscox Europe. Supported by Informatica platform, we aim to create the necessary processes, data quality rules, data lineage, data dictionaries, business

glossaries, reference data repository (amongst others) to ensure we have a robust analytics solution for the future.

These new Data Management practices are part of the wider strategic objectives of our European Data Strategy. As we build our new Data & Analytics solution, we want to be able to build the necessary governance around it.

Considering this strategic Data journey, we are going through in Europe, there is the opportunity to shape the path and deliver the outcome. There is also the need for you to contribute and work with the team in delivering our current commitments, so business as usual is part of this role.

What does a Data Quality Analyst do?

A Data Quality Analyst is a subject matter expert in Data Management, responsible for:


Data governance processes and policies delivering
Data quality assessment and monitoring using a Data Management tool
Business concepts consolidation and alignment
The ultimate objective is not only to ensure the robustness of Data & Analytics Platform, but also to expand the remit of these capabilities to our wider European application spectrum.
Main activities for this role should be:
Analyse Data Quality issues reported by Hiscox teams and act accordingly to fix them at the data source.
Monitor data quality improvements using reports / dashboards.
Identify and analyse BAU changes with impact on business mappings according to business requirements.
Maintain and implement changes on Data Management tool according to the : data quality rules, business glossary terms and metrics, workflows and data portfolio.
Monitor jobs execution on Data Management tool to ensure a correct update of catalogues based on the source systems, validate new scores of data quality processes and data profiling results.
Implement data governance processes and workflows that orchestrate the entry, validation and approval of data changes using data governance tools (Informatica) to ensure policy compliance and change awareness over the Business Units.
Ensure data compliance and data usage control in collaboration with Europe Privacy team.
Contribute to a unique view of business concepts for all regions/business teams, by identifying and reporting inconsistencies in their definition or calculation.
Support data consumers on self-service and concepts clarification.



Technical must-haves


Bachelor’s / Master’s degree, ideally in Management / Computer Science / Mathematic / Economics / Statistics (or similar)
Previous background in Data & Analytics roles (2 or more years), preferably in Data Management (e.g. Data Quality)
Knowledge of SQL or analytical/reporting tools required to perform data analysis
Ability to understand business needs and translate them to technical requirements
Fluent in English, verbally and written



Personality trades


Motivated self-starter who can work autonomously and add value in a team
Passionate with a can-do attitude, looking forward to find ways to improve the way we manage our data
Thirst for new ways of working to add value to the business
Ability to sell ideas and concepts providing background knowledge and information to the team as well as internal customers
Ability to link business needs to technical deliveries
Customer relationship management – ability to build productive relationships with end users and deliver robust solutions to them
Business focused
Ability to work with ambiguity and change
Flexibility in both attitude and delivery style
Resilience



Nice to haves


Experience in Business Intelligence, Data & Analytics
Experience with Microsoft Business Intelligence and Analytics tools
Previous experience with Data Management tools (Informatica preferable, SAS, Talend or any other relevant)
Knowledge of Power BI to understand the data models and validate KPIs calculations
Experience with Agile/Scrum based methodologies
Experience in the Financial Services sector



Work with amazing people and be part of a unique culture
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Python e SQL com Cloud (m/f) – Híbrido (Lisboa)
Description:
Descrição da Empresa

Somos uma Consultora com competências multidisciplinares dotada de um portfólio que abrange diversas áreas, como Financeira, Telecomunicações, Automóvel. Desenvolvemos Produtos e Projectos. Estamos presentes em empresas de referência Nacionais e Internacionais. A nossa combinação única de soluções tecnológicas, metodologias e os nossos recursos humanos qualificam a entrega aos nossos clientes.

Descrição da Função

A Match Profiler é uma consultora de Sistemas de Informação que atua desde 1999 no mercado nacional e internacional. Temos competências multidisciplinares e know-how na área de IT que nos permite contribuir, otimizar e progredir com os nossos clientes. Para integrar equipa do nosso cliente estamos de momento a recrutar profissionais com o seguinte perfil: Data Analyst Python e SQL com Cloud (m/f) – Híbrido (Lisboa) O que precisas de ter: Hard skills


7 ou mais anos de experiência em ciência e análise de dados, com um historial comprovado de liderança de projectos de ciência de dados bem sucedidos.
Proficiência em linguagens de programação, incluindo Python e SQL, juntamente com bibliotecas e estruturas avançadas como TensorFlow ou Pytorch.
Possuir um conhecimento profundo de análise estatística, aprendizagem automática, modelação preditiva e resolução avançada de problemas algorítmicos.
Demonstrar uma vasta experiência em visualização e interpretação de dados, traduzindo resultados complexos em informações accionáveis.
Possuir conhecimentos de domínio técnico em plataformas de computação em nuvem (AWS, Azure, GCP) ou tecnologias de grandes volumes de dados (Spark). Soft skills
Boa comunicação
Espírito de equipa
Proactividade
Gestão de tempo O que nós podemos proporcionar:
Acompanhamento personalizado por parte da tua equipa
O teu manager vai estar atento às tuas motivações e sugestões
As vitórias e conquistas serão festejadas em conjunto
Acompanhamento da nossa equipa de Recursos Humanos e Suporte
Feedback constante do teu trabalho
Uma rede de centenas de parcerias com empresas de inúmeros setores que te oferecem descontos exclusivos (saúde, bem-estar, viagens, gastronomia, cultura, lazer, formação, etc)
E como é óbvio bastantes eventos e convívios Localização
Lisboa, Portugal

Title: SQL Developer
HTML:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: SQL Developer

Seniority: mid level

The amazing you, will have:


  • Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or software development;
  • Good knowledge of English;
  • Expertise in Unix development;
  • Hands-on experience in T-SQL development;
  • Some development skills in Java;
  • Development in Unix, T-SQL and some Java 1.8 components;
  • Technical analysis based on company requirements;
  • Communication with the support team to deal with escalations;
  • Monitor the entire project life cycle;



Why should you become part of our family?

  • You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
  • Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
  • Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
  • International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
  • Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
  • In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
  • Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
  • Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
  • Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!


Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
We offer comprehensive market support and actively develop various high-tech blockchain products. Having successfully collaborated with over 1,500 clients, Gotbit has honed its expertise in designing user-friendly and effective blockchain solutions for businesses and end-users alike.

Who We Are

Gotbit has been in the market since 2017 and has established itself as a Tier-1 International Crypto Company. We offer comprehensive market support and actively develop various high-tech blockchain products. Having successfully collaborated with over 1,500 clients, Gotbit has honed its expertise in designing user-friendly and effective blockchain solutions for businesses and end-users alike.

Our team of over 200 skilled professionals spans the globe, bringing diverse perspectives and expertise to our projects.

Currently, our Consulting Department is looking for a Lead Data Analyst.

Responsibilities


Design, implement, and maintain data warehouses; ensure data integrity and consistency
Develop and manage ETL processes for accurate and efficient data integration; ensure smooth data flow for analytics
Analyze data for product performance and customer behavior; conduct A/B tests, develop strategies to improve key metrics and marketing ROI
Create and maintain interactive dashboards using tools like Tableau or Power BI; ensure they provide real-time insights
Lead a team of data analytics experts; collaborate with IT, marketing, and product teams; present findings and recommendations to stakeholders clearly and concisely


Requirements


Over 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst
Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, or other relevant programming languages
Experience with data warehousing solutions
Expertise in data visualization tools
Experience in product analytics tools
Understanding of ETL processes and tools
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex datasets
Fluent English (C1-C2)


Gotbit Offers


Remote work from any location
20 paid vacation days and 5 sick days annually
Full compensation for documented sick leave
Wellness support: We value our employees' well-being and cover expenses for sports, healthcare, coworking spaces, and team-building events
Continuous learning: Monthly Gotbit Educational Meetups featuring industry leaders help you stay ahead of the curve
Collaborative environment: Join our friendly and young team where all of your ideas will be heard


We look forward to receiving your application

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m / f / d)
Description:
Location

hybrid in Lisbon (3 home office days per week)

SHAPE THE FUTURE OF PRIVACY WITH USERCENTRICS

Usercentrics is a global leader in data privacy and privacy-led marketing solutions. We believe there is no need for a trade-off between growth and privacy compliance. Our vision is to unlock the potential of data privacy to empower a thriving digital ecosystem. We work with companies to create a healthy balance between data-driven business and privacy-led marketing for every size of enterprise. Our customers build trust with their users through improved transparency and control to drastically improve marketing and monetization, while achieving full privacy compliance.

We are looking for a self driven, curious, and analytical individual to join as a Senior Data Analyst. You will work with cross functional teams to help solve complex business problems and draw relevant insights by leveraging data, building scalable processes, and compelling visualization. Your interventions are backed by compelling storytelling capabilities that are built on the back of a deep understanding of our commercial insights.

Your Tasks


Partner with our business stakeholders, product and tech teams to define complex and ambiguous problems and solve them with data
Develop innovative analytical methodologies to answer strategic business questions across the organization that helps us become more data-driven
Relentlessly challenge the status quo and uncover business patterns in our processes to drive efficiency, speed, quality, and cost savings
Demonstrated success working with executives at the most senior levels, developing an analytics roadmap, and providing recommendations that direct business strategy and achieve high impact results


You Bring


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience ideally in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Quantitative, Physics, Engineering, etc.) preferred
Background in strategy consulting and/or tech scale ups, SaaS
5+ years in SaaS B2B preferred
5+ years of work experience in SQL/Python and data visualization & business intelligence tools (ideally PowerBI) to communicate business insights using data
Intellectually curious, high energy, and strong work ethic; passionate about working with, normalizing, and synthesizing large amounts of data into actionable insights
Process-oriented with strong organizational and communication skills
Ability to identify and succinctly summarize roadblocks and constraints, propose potential solutions, and drive towards resolution
Fluency in English with strong verbal and written communication skills


Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Usercentrics we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Why join Usercentrics?


Joining Usercentrics means becoming part of a fast-growing, diverse and international team of tech enthusiasts and entrepreneurially-minded who build our success story together
Company culture is important to us - we strive to continuously develop a positive, vibrant and inspiring environment that enables everyone to thrive both personally and professionally
Get involved! We have plenty of initiatives and love to see people from all department enthusiastically participating and shaping our future together in different cross-department projects
Your work-life balance is important to us too - we offer flexible working hours, hybrid working and the possibility of workcations (in accordance with our company policy)
We always remember to have fun along the way, both in our day-to-day work and at our regular team events on site in our offices in Munich, Copenhagen, Odense, Lisbon and Prague or online
You are the most valuable asset to our company which is why we’re happy to offer awesome benefits like our personal development budget, job-related language courses and a lot more (depending on your location) to focus on your well being


About Us

We are driven by our values #BeBrave, #BetterTogether, #LeadbyExample, #InnovateWithPurpose, #PassionForPrivacy, #GiveBack and #ComeAsYouAre. They show what we believe in and how we work. They help make our team special and guide us in everything we do. They're the heart of our company and inspire us to do our best every day.

We strive to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment (DEI) where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential. We believe that our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are our greatest strengths — so we are committed to building with them as we foster innovation and drive our success.

We recognize that this is an ongoing journey. We commit to listening and to continuous learning, growth, and improvement. By embracing DEI principles, we will create a more just and equitable society, and we are proud to play our part in making this vision a reality.

We are #BetterTogether.
Show more

  • Develop innovative analytical methodologies to answer strategic business questions across the organization that helps us become more data-driven
  • Relentlessly challenge the status quo and uncover business patterns in our processes to drive efficiency, speed, quality, and cost savings
  • Demonstrated success working with executives at the most senior levels, developing an analytics roadmap, and providing recommendations that direct business strategy and achieve high impact results

You Bring

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience ideally in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Quantitative, Physics, Engineering, etc.) preferred
  • Background in strategy consulting and/or tech scale ups, SaaS
  • 5+ years in SaaS B2B preferred
  • 5+ years of work experience in SQL/Python and data visualization & business intelligence tools (ideally PowerBI) to communicate business insights using data
  • Intellectually curious, high energy, and strong work ethic; passionate about working with, normalizing, and synthesizing large amounts of data into actionable insights
  • Process-oriented with strong organizational and communication skills
  • Ability to identify and succinctly summarize roadblocks and constraints, propose potential solutions, and drive towards resolution
  • Fluency in English with strong verbal and written communication skills

Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Usercentrics we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Why join Usercentrics?

  • Joining Usercentrics means becoming part of a fast-growing, diverse and international team of tech enthusiasts and entrepreneurially-minded who build our success story together
  • Company culture is important to us - we strive to continuously develop a positive, vibrant and inspiring environment that enables everyone to thrive both personally and professionally
  • Get involved! We have plenty of initiatives and love to see people from all department enthusiastically participating and shaping our future together in different cross-department projects
  • Your work-life balance is important to us too - we offer flexible working hours, hybrid working and the possibility of workcations (in accordance with our company policy)
  • We always remember to have fun along the way, both in our day-to-day work and at our regular team events on site in our offices in Munich, Copenhagen, Odense, Lisbon and Prague or online
  • You are the most valuable asset to our company which is why we’re happy to offer awesome benefits like our personal development budget, job-related language courses and a lot more (depending on your location) to focus on your well being

About Us

We are driven by our values #BeBrave, #BetterTogether, #LeadbyExample, #InnovateWithPurpose, #PassionForPrivacy, #GiveBack and #ComeAsYouAre. They show what we believe in and how we work. They help make our team special and guide us in everything we do. They're the heart of our company and inspire us to do our best every day.

We strive to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment (DEI) where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential. We believe that our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are our greatest strengths — so we are committed to building with them as we foster innovation and drive our success.

We recognize that this is an ongoing journey. We commit to listening and to continuous learning, growth, and improvement. By embracing DEI principles, we will create a more just and equitable society, and we are proud to play our part in making this vision a reality.

We are #BetterTogether.

Title: HR Data Analyst - Banca
HTML:
Procura integrar um HR Business Controller que irá integrar a Direção de Recursos Humanos, onde ficará alocado a uma área mais relacionada com remunerações e orçamento do Departamento.

Sobre o nosso cliente

O nosso cliente é uma instituição bancária de referência.

Principais responsabilidades

  • Gestão do orçamento da Direção de Recursos Humanos;
  • Contabilização de custos com pessoal diretamente em sistema;
  • Acompanhamento da implementação das políticas de remunerações;
  • Acompanhamento de toda a atividade de gestão e processamento salarial
  • Monitorização da evolução dos orçamentos anuais de custos com pessoal e headcount, reportando evoluções periódicas e propondo medidas corretivas;
  • Participação no desenho e parametrização das soluções tecnológicas, promovendo a digitalização de todos os processos da responsabilidade da equipa.

Perfil desejado

  • Habilitações literárias ao nível da licenciatura em Gestão, Gestão de Recursos Humanos, Economia, Contabilidade ou equivalente;
  • Experiência comprovada na área de gestão orçamental e contabilização de custos com pessoal;
  • Conhecimentos/experiência na área de processamento salarial;
  • Alguns conhecimentos de legislação laboral (preferêncial);
  • Forte capacidade analítica;
  • Bom espirito de equipa.

Benefícios adicionais


Desired Skills and Experience

Descritivo de Função:
- Gestão do orçamento da Direção de Recursos Humanos;
- Contabilização de custos com pessoal diretamente em sistema;
- Acompanhamento da implementação das políticas de remunerações;
- Acompanhamento de toda a atividade de gestão e processamento salarial
- Monitorização da evolução dos orçamentos anuais de custos com pessoal e headcount, reportando evoluções periódicas e propondo medidas corretivas;
- Participação no desenho e parametrização das soluções tecnológicas, promovendo a digitalização de todos os processos da responsabilidade da equipa.

Perfil:
- Habilitações literárias ao nível da licenciatura em Gestão, Gestão de Recursos Humanos, Economia, Contabilidade ou equivalente;
- Experiência comprovada na área de gestão orçamental e contabilização de custos com pessoal;
- Conhecimentos/experiência na área de processamento salarial;
- Alguns conhecimentos de legislação laboral (preferêncial);
- Forte capacidade analítica;
- Bom espirito de equipa.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

AUTODOC is the largest and fastest growing auto parts ecommerce platform in Europe.

Present across 27 countries with around 5,000 employees, AUTODOC generated revenue of over €1.3 billion in 2023, supplying more than 7.4 million active customers with its 5.8 million vehicle parts and accessories for car, truck, and motorcycle brands.

Curious minds, adventurous experts and tech-savvy professionals - one team, one billion euros revenue. Catch the ride!

Job Description

As Product Data Analyst you will be responsible for creating and managing comprehensive reports and self-serving tools, conducting in-depth analysis of market trends and user behavior, and delivering statistical insights that highlight the impact of our product initiatives in the business.

Responsibilities


Conduct deep-dive analysis into product performance, customer behavior and market trends to identify opportunities for product enhancement and innovation.
Collaborate with product teams to define key performance indicators (KPI) and develop dashboards and reports that track product success and inform strategic decisions.
Utilize advanced analytics and predictive modeling to forecast demand, customer preferences and provide support to business case development for product roadmap.
Engage in cross-functional projects to ensure that data insights are integrated into product development and customer experience strategies.
Collaborate with data engineering and data science teams to continuously refine data collection, transformation and analysis methods to improve accuracy, quality, efficiency, and governance.
Design, guide, execute and analyze experiments to test hypotheses related to product enhancements and customer experience improvements.



Requirements


Minimum of 3 years of experience in data analytics or related fields, preference for experience with product analytics.
Bachelor’s or Master degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics or a related field with strong quantitative foundation.
Expertise in analytical and statistical tools and languages (eg. SQL, Python) and familiarity with A/B testing and other experimentation frameworks.
Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and to communicate these effectively across technical and non-technical audiences.
Comprehensive knowledge of e-commerce including and customer journey, shopping funnels and behavior analysis.
Proven experience designing and maintaining dashboards using leading BI tools.
Experience with ETL processes and orchestration is highly desirable.
Fluency in English, with excellent written and verbal communication skills.



What do we offer?


Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
Fast growing international company with stable employment
Annual vacation and 1 additional day off on your birthday
Mental Wellbeing Program – the opportunity for free psychological counseling for you and your family members 24/7 hotline and online sessions
Opportunities for advancement, further trainings (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform) and coaching
Free English and German language classes - Flexible working hours and hybrid work



Join us today and let’s create a success story together!

Title: RISK Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


Themission of RISK is to provide Senior Management of the Group and of theOperating Divisions, with full transparency and dynamic analysis of the riskand clients managed by Corporate and Investment Banking (CIB) and InvestmentSolutions (IS) business units
RISKcontributes to the definition of the Group’s risk appetite, its riskdecision-making process and the optimization of capital allocation to supportthe development of the Operating Divisions
RISKSystems team is part of RISK. Its mission consists in providing the Bank with acomprehensive capital markets risk system used to calculate market andcounterparty risk capital figures using advanced methods and to support theneeds of users for risk analysis, risk reporting and the credit process
Inthis context, Operations team is a global team responsible for the productionof market and counterparty risk metrics to the RISK function. The team is splitbetween London, Paris, Hong Kong, New York, Singapore, Mumbai, Brussels,Montreal, Sao Paulo, Lisbon and Porto
Operationsteam is in charge of functional support on market and counterparty risk systemsof the bank. The team in Portugal is focusing in particular on the qualityaspects of the data that feeds those systems: ensuring data quality issues areresolved, putting in place meaningful Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) aboutdata quality, reviewing and improving existing processes and KPIs, andassisting on the preparation of material for committees where those KPIs arediscussed
Themission of Operations team is met by:
Ensuringclients and Senior management have a clear vision of the quality of theservices provided by Operation teams, thanks to the production of meaningfulKPIs about our main services.
Resolutionof incidents related to data quality.
Regularcalibration of market variables used for the calculation of risk metrics.
Streamlining,running, documenting existing processes that currently lack industrialisation

Your Main Activities Are


Workon Data quality aspects, putting in place Key Performance Indicators about thequality of the data in our systems (statistics on timeliness and quality ofdaily risk indicators) and maintaining these KPIs
Investigateissues detected by those KPIs and help to resolve them permanently.
Tohelp on the regular analysis and update of the parameters used in riskmanagement systems (such as interest rates or FX rates). Help to explainValue-at-Risk movements based on recent updates of such market variables
Providetraining and guidance to new users of the system where required
Buildclose links with risk analysts and other internal RISK Systems clients

Profile and Skills to Success


BachelorDegree in Business / Finance / Mathematics / IT or related
Advancedlevel of English, both written and oral
Knowledgein
MSOffice Pack
PowerBI
Good marketand/or Counterparty Risk knowledge
Attentionto detail / rigor
Abilityto deliver / results driven
Organisationalskills

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Analyst for a project based in Porto (hybrid - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

  • BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math or a similar area;
  • Experience in data workflow creation (data preparation and data reconciliation) in Alteryx or similar data analytics tools (for example Dataiku, Knime, etc.);
  • Experience with Business Intelligence - Data visualization tools, mainly Power BI;
  • Experience to develop and maintain Power Apps and Power Automate solutions (mandatory);
  • Good knowledge about SQL;
  • Fluent English (mandatory);
  • The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).


If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to catarina.sa@decskill.com with reference “CS/Data_Analyst”.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Somos a Glintt Global, uma empresa de matriz portuguesa, líder em tecnologia, com mais de 30 anos de experiência. Pretendemos impactar a qualidade de vida das pessoas através da inovação, tecnologia, do conhecimento e da ambição que nos acompanham. Este é o nosso compromisso!

Para tal, precisamos de ti! Procuramos um Data Analyst para integrar a equipa de Glintt Life- Hospitals- Services, nos nossos escritórios do Porto. Na nossa empresa, terás a oportunidade de aliar todos os teus interesses e competências para nos ajudar a tornar o mundo um pouco mais Glintter!

Como será o teu dia a dia na Glintt?

  • Acompanhamento do cliente;
  • Tradução das necessidades analíticas dos clientes;
  • Análise de requisitos;
  • Modelação e preparação da informação para o perfil do projeto;



O que achamos que precisas de ter?

  • Conhecimentos e experiência em análise funcional;
  • Conhecimentos técnicos em metodologias de levantamento de requisitos, em particular para Data Products;
  • Conhecimentos e experiência no desenvolvimento de Dashboards, Reports, Workflows, UseCases, Data Flows e Process Flows;
  • Conhecimento e experiência em plataformas de BI (PowerBi, Tableau, Metabase, Looker);
  • Conhecimento e experiência de SQL e Python;
  • Conhecimentos e interesse na área da saúde.
  • Conhecimentos e experiência de sistemas de informação da área hospitalar.
  • Visão analítica e rigor;
  • Autonomia, iniciativa e proatividade;
  • Orientação para os resultados;
  • Team Worker.



O que vais encontrar na Glintt?

  • Ambiente de trabalho incrível;
  • Investimento nas tuas competências;
  • Respeito pela tua individualidade;
  • Autonomia e reconhecimento pelo teu sucesso;
  • Instalações preparadas ao detalhe para que te sintas em casa.



Qual o nosso plano para ti?

  • Mentoria;
  • Plano de carreira adaptado às tuas capacidades;
  • Plano de formação individual em soft e hard skills;
  • Participação em projetos desafiantes;
  • Possibilidade de fazer a diferença na vida das pessoas.



Caso ainda não tenhas ficado convencido/a, oferecemos ainda:

  • Workshops e promoção de um estilo de vida saudável
  • Salário fixo e variável
  • Seguro de saúde
  • E muito mais...



E muito mais…

Ficaste entusiasmado/a? Consideras-te a pessoa ideal para esta função? De que estás à espera? Não percas mais tempo e candidata-te a vir ser feliz nesta aventura!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Place: São Mamede de Infesta, Porto, Portugal
HTML:
Como imaginas o futuro?

O nosso propósito é criar um futuro mais inteligente para uma vida melhor.

Contamos contigo para te juntares a nós e ajudares a construir um mundo melhor para as gerações futuras.

Quem somos:

A Efacec é uma empresa com 75 anos de história a inovar pelo mundo que partilhamos, atuando em setores estruturantes para a sociedade e de reconhecida importância em todas as geografias em que está presente, promovendo a mudança e impactando positivamente milhões de pessoas.

Em Portugal, estamos nos polos da Arroteia (sede), Maia e Oeiras, tendo ainda uma pegada global com presença em 13 países e vendas em mais de 86 países.

O que procuramos:

Estamos à procura de um(a) IT Consultant para reforçar a equipa de Sistemas de Informação, localizada no Polo da Arroteia, Matosinhos.

Missão:

  • Customizações, design e codificação;
  • Interagir com os utilizadores, recolher requisitos, desenvolver especificações, desenvolver e testar programas;
  • Trabalhar de forma eficaz com membros de equipas multifuncionais e utilizadores;
  • Tarefas relacionadas com a manutenção do sistema e tempo de atividade (aplicação de patches, testes);
  • Assumir a responsabilidade pela solução e encerramento de pedidos de suporte no helpdesk para a base de utilizadores a nível mundial;
  • Documentar alterações de acordo com as melhores práticas para garantir uma gestão de conhecimento bem-sucedida.


Perfil:

  • Formação em Ciências da Computação ou experiência de trabalho equivalente;
  • Mínimo de 3 anos de desenvolvimento em SQL utilizando Microsoft SQL Server, procedimentos armazenados, design e otimização de bases de dados;
  • Mínimo de 3 anos de desenvolvimento em SQL com SSIS, SSRS e SSAS;
  • Mínimo de 3 anos de desenvolvimento com PowerBI;
  • Conhecimento intermediário de MS Excel, SharePoint e PowerPlatform (PowerApps, Automate) é uma vantagem;
  • Domínio da língua Inglesa (falada e escrita);
  • Dinamismo e proatividade;
  • Sentido de responsabilidade e compromisso;
  • Capacidade de organização e planeamento;
  • Espírito de equipa;
  • Orientação para a mudança e inovação.


O que oferecemos:

  • Possibilidade de integrar um grupo empresarial de referência com forte presença internacional;
  • Possibilidade de aprendizagem e capacitação num regime de “learning by doing”;
  • Acesso a formação através da nossa Mast3r Academia (Academia de formação interna) e de instituições de ensino;
  • Acesso permanente aos nossos serviços médicos e de enfermagem;
  • Acesso a protocolos e parcerias estratégicas;
  • Possibilidade de trabalhar num regime híbrido (presencial/remoto).

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers. With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.


Neotalent, the responsive people.


What is your mission:

We are looking for a Data Analyst to integrate one of our biggest clients in the banking sector.


The client in question is one of the biggest banks in europe, with activity in over 70 countries around the world, it also counts with over 150 years of existence which means that is an extremely consolidated player in the banking industry. You will join an international and diverse team.


Main Tasks:

  • Design and maintain dashboards in Tableau;
  • Design data ingestion pipelines to gather data from various sources such as databases, APIs and files;
  • Design data processing pipelines to clean, filter and pre-process data for analysis;
  • Optimize data pipelines, framework code, cluster utilization and configuration to ensure the best performance from pipelines;
  • Design, maintain and enforce data governance and data catalogue;
  • Maintain a coherent documentation of the framework, cluster and projects;
  • Collaborate with data scientists, data analysts and stakeholders to elicit data requirements and deliver effective solutions;
  • Communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders effectively;
  • Evaluate and recommend new tools, frameworks and techniques to improve our data engineering projects and platform;
  • Work in a continuous development framework with iterative deliveries, respecting deadlines and actively following tasks.


The talent we are looking for:

  • Previous experience working with Python;
  • Experience creating data sources and dashboards on Data Visualization software like Tableau and PowerBI;
  • Proficiency in SQL queries and a good understanding of database architecture;
  • Comfortable with the english language (mandatory).


Why Neotalent:

  • More than 20 years of experience in technology and business development;
  • Access to ongoing technical training and solid performance evaluation and career management methodologies;
  • Opportunity to be seen and recognized, to work on the best projects and to make choices that guarantee an exciting career;
  • Opportunity to work on international projects and be part of an Everyshore for EveryChallenge paradigm.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there’s a constant need to be innovative.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there’s always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now, and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Businesses.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.

As a part of your job, you will:


Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis;
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems;
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations;
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management;
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.



What are we looking for?


Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.



Personal traits:

Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients

Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy

Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included

Willingness to collaborate with other players

Strong communication skills

We want people who like to roll up their sleeves and open their minds. Believe this is you? Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions – addressing Telecommunications, Energy & Utilities, Financial Services and other markets' strategic opportunities.

Serving Clients in 25+ countries, Celfocus delivers solutions such as accelerating digital network transformation in Autonomous Networks, elevating and monetising business services in B2B2x ecosystems, and providing highly relevant customer experiences through Hyper-personalisation solutions.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 45+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions 🤘

We’re looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard 🦬 From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch 👇

What You’ll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.
Show more
